plots.summary: Pate, a novice at the Citadel, meets with an alchemist who promised to give him a gold dragon in exchange for a stolen key. Pate struggles with his decision to become a thief, reflecting on his unfulfilled dreams of becoming a maester and his desire for Rosey, a serving girl. The chapter explores the dynamics among Citadel students, introduces mysterious elements like glass candles and rumors of dragons, and ends with Pate making the exchange with the alchemist.

key_characters.name: Pate
key_characters.description: A novice at the Citadel who has been there for five years without earning a link.
key_characters.experience: Pate is torn between his desire to become a maester and his infatuation with Rosey. He ultimately decides to steal a key from Archmaester Walgrave to trade with the alchemist for a gold dragon.

key_characters.name: Alchemist
key_characters.description: A mysterious figure who offers to trade a gold dragon for a key from the Citadel.
key_characters.experience: The alchemist meets with Pate to complete their agreed-upon exchange, manipulating Pate into stealing the key.

key_characters.name: Alleras
key_characters.description: Also known as the Sphinx, a skilled acolyte at the Citadel from Dorne.
key_characters.experience: Alleras participates in discussions about dragons and demonstrates his archery skills. He seems more knowledgeable and accomplished than his peers.

key_characters.name: Leo Tyrell
key_characters.description: A noble-born acolyte known as Lazy Leo, arrogant and provocative.
key_characters.experience: Leo antagonizes the other students, particularly Pate, and claims to have seen a glass candle burning in the Mage's chambers.

conversation.scenario: In the winding streets of Oldtown near the Citadel, Pate anxiously awaits the alchemist after leaving the Quill and Tankard tavern. It's late at night, and the cobblestone streets are dimly lit by flickering torches. The weight of his decision to steal Archmaester Walgrave's key weighs heavily on Pate. The air is thick with tension and the faint smell of the nearby Honeywine River. Shadows dance on ancient stone walls as Pate nervously fidgets, his stolen prize hidden beneath his robes.
conversation.topic: The exchange of the stolen key for a gold dragon

key_characters.name: Pate
key_characters.motivation: Overwhelmed with anxiety and guilt, Pate wrestles with his conscience. He desperately wants the gold dragon to win Rosey's affections, but fears the consequences of his theft. Torn between his dreams of becoming a maester and his immediate desires, Pate feels cornered and out of his depth. He's wary of the alchemist but determined to see this through.

key_characters.name: Alchemist
key_characters.motivation: Calm and calculating, the alchemist approaches with practiced ease. His true motives hidden, he sees Pate as a mere pawn in a larger scheme. The alchemist aims to manipulate Pate's naivety and desperation, carefully balancing pressure and reassurance to secure the key. He's prepared to adapt his tactics as needed to achieve his goal.

dialogues.message: [I must approach carefully to not spook him.] Good morrow, Pate.
[My heart is racing. This is really happening.] (rises from the ground, nervously) The third day... you said you would be at the Quill and Tankard.
[He's on edge. I need to seem reasonable.] You were with your friends. It was not my wish to intrude upon your fellowship. (pauses) Have you decided what you are?
[I hate admitting this out loud.] (hesitantly) I suppose I am a thief.
[Good, he's committed to the act.] I thought you might be.
[I need to see the gold to be sure this is worth it.] Do you have my dragon?
[I must maintain control of the situation.] If you have what I require.
[I won't be cheated.] (insistently) Give it here. I want to see.
[We need more privacy for this exchange.] The river road is not the place. Come.
The alchemist begins walking away, forcing Pate to follow him through various alleys and streets of Oldtown.
[This has gone far enough. I need to take control.] (nervously) This is far enough. There's no one about. We'll do it here.
[He's getting impatient. Time to show the prize.] As you wish. (produces the gold dragon)
[It's so close now. I can almost feel it.] I want my dragon.
[The fool is entranced by the gold. He's mine now.] (manipulates the coin across his knuckles) To be sure.
[I can't believe I'm actually doing this.] (grabs the coin and bites it) If truth be told, I wasn't sure what gold

plots.summary: Brienne, accompanied by Podrick Payne and their guide Nimble Dick Crabb, travels through Crackclaw Point. Brienne remains wary of Crabb, taking precautions to protect their gold and herself. Crabb regales them with local tales and history, showcasing the region's fierce independence and mistrust of outsiders.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A warrior woman on a quest, cautious and mistrustful of their guide.
key_characters.experience: Brienne takes precautions to protect herself and their resources, showing her wariness of Nimble Dick. She reflects on her past and maintains a stoic demeanor throughout the journey.

key_characters.name: Nimble Dick Crabb
key_characters.description: A local guide with questionable trustworthiness, leading Brienne and Podrick through Crackclaw Point.
key_characters.experience: Crabb attempts to gain Brienne's trust through charm and local knowledge, but his actions, such as trying to search her saddlebags, reveal his dubious nature.

key_characters.name: Podrick Payne
key_characters.description: Brienne's young squire, loyal but inexperienced.
key_characters.experience: Podrick shows his loyalty to Brienne by agreeing to watch over her while she sleeps and attempting to protect their belongings from Crabb.

conversation.scenario: In the rugged terrain of Crackclaw Point, Brienne of Tarth, her young squire Podrick Payne, and their dubious guide Nimble Dick Crabb make their way through the wilderness. The air is thick with tension as night approaches, bringing with it the need for increased vigilance. The trio has been traveling for days, with Brienne constantly on guard against potential threats, particularly from their guide. The wild, untamed landscape of Crackclaw Point surrounds them, its fierce independence and mistrust of outsiders palpable in the very air they breathe. As they prepare to make camp for the night, Brienne must strategize to ensure their safety without completely alienating their potentially untrustworthy guide.
conversation.topic: Protecting themselves from potential threats, particularly their guide Nimble Dick Crabb

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.motivation: I must remain vigilant and protect our party, especially from Nimble Dick Crabb. Podrick's assistance could be vital, but I need to instruct him carefully without alarming him. I'm wary of our surroundings and our guide's intentions, yet I must maintain a calm exterior. My quest to find and protect Sansa Stark drives me forward, despite the dangers we face.

key_characters.name: Podrick Payne
key_characters.motivation: I'm eager to prove my worth to Lady Brienne, but I'm uncertain about my abilities. The responsibility of watching over her while she sleeps is daunting, yet I'm determined not to let her down. I'm nervous about the potential threats, especially from Crabb, but I want to show Lady Brienne that I can be relied upon. I must stay alert and follow her instructions precisely.

dialogues.message: [I need to be clear and firm, but not alarm Podrick too much.] Podrick, there will come a time when there are no more inns to shelter us. I do not trust our guide. When we make camp, can you watch over me as I sleep?
[I'm nervous about this responsibility, but I want to help.] Stay awake, my lady? Ser. (hesitates) I have a sword. If Crabb tries to hurt you, I could kill him.

[I appreciate his eagerness, but I must temper it with caution.] No. (firmly) You are not to try and fight him. All I ask is that you watch him as I sleep, and wake me if he does anything suspicious. I wake quickly, you will find.
[I'm relieved I don't have to fight, but still nervous about the responsibility.] Yes, my lady. Ser. I'll watch carefully.
[I need to reassure him.] You're doing well, Podrick. Your vigilance is important to our safety.
[I feel a bit more confident now.] Thank you, my lady. I won't let you down.
[I should give him more specific instructions.] If you see Crabb approach our belongings or my sleeping area, wake me immediately. Don't confront him yourself.
[I'm trying to memorize her instructions.] Wake you immediately. Don't confront. I understand.
[I hope I'm not overwhelming him.] And Podrick, remember to rest when I'm awake. We both need to stay alert on this journey.
[I'm grateful for her concern.] Yes, my lady. I'll rest when you're awake. Thank you for looking out for me too.

plots.summary: Aeron Greyjoy, known as the Damphair, learns of King Balon's death. He reflects on his past and his transformation into a priest of the Drowned God. Aeron calls for a kingsmoot to choose the next ruler of the Iron Islands, rejecting both Euron and Asha as potential successors.

key_characters.name: Aeron Greyjoy
key_characters.description: The Damphair, a priest of the Drowned God and brother to Balon Greyjoy.
key_characters.experience: Aeron learns of Balon's death, reflects on his past, and calls for a kingsmoot to choose the next ruler, opposing Euron's claim to the throne.

key_characters.name: Balon Greyjoy
key_characters.description: The recently deceased King of the Iron Islands.
key_characters.experience: Balon's death sets the stage for the succession crisis and the call for a kingsmoot.

key_characters.name: Euron Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Balon's exiled brother, known as the Crow's Eye.
key_characters.experience: Euron returns to claim the Seastone Chair, causing concern for Aeron who believes him to be godless and unfit to rule.

conversation.scenario: On a beach in the Iron Islands, Aeron Greyjoy addresses a crowd after learning of King Balon's death. As a priest of the Drowned God, he sees this as a crucial moment to guide his people. The air is tense with uncertainty about succession. Aeron aims to invoke ancient traditions to determine the next ruler, rejecting both Euron's claim and the idea of Asha inheriting.
conversation.topic: The death of King Balon and the call for a kingsmoot

key_characters.name: Aeron Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: I must ensure our next ruler follows the Drowned God's ways. A kingsmoot is the only path forward, returning to our old traditions. I cannot let Euron or any unworthy successor take the Seastone Chair.

key_characters.name: Lord Merlyn
key_characters.motivation: These are chaotic times for the Iron Islands. I need clear direction on where to pledge my support and send my ships. The priest's words are cryptic, but he may provide guidance in this turmoil.

dialogues.message: [The Drowned God has shown me the way. I must lead our people to the right path.] We were born from the sea, and to the sea we all return. The Storm God in his wrath plucked Balon from his castle and cast him down, and now he feasts beneath the waves in the Drowned God's watery halls. (raises his hands) Balon is dead! The king is dead! Yet a king will come again! For what is dead may never die, but rises again, harder and stronger! A king will rise!
(chanting in unison) [We trust in the Damphair's wisdom.] A king will rise!

[This uncertainty is troubling. I need clear direction.] The king is dead. I had a bird. And now another. One raven summons me to Pyke, another to Ten Towers. You krakens have too many arms, you pull a man to pieces. What say you, priest? Where should I send my longships?
[The Drowned God's will must be done.] The Drowned God shall decide who sits the Seastone Chair. Kneel, that I might bless you.
Lord Merlyn kneels before Aeron, who pours seawater over his head in blessing.

Lord God who drowned for us, let Meldred your servant be born again from the sea. Bless him with salt, bless him with stone, bless him with steel. What is dead may never die, but rises again, harder and stronger.
[I still need answers.] (rising) Is it Asha, then? Or Victarion? Tell us, priest!

[The old ways must be restored.] The Drowned God will tell you, but not here. Look not to me, nor to the laws of men, but to the sea. Raise your sails and unship your oars, my lord, and take yourself to Old Wyk. You, and all the captains and the kings.

[This is the will of the Drowned God.] Go not to Pyke, to bow before the godless, nor to Harlaw, to consort with scheming women. Point your prow toward Old Wyk, where stood the Grey King's Hall. In the name of the Drowned God I summon you. I summon all of you! Leave your halls and hovels, your castles and your keeps, and return to Nagga's hill to make a kingsmoot!
[A kingsmoot? This is unexpected.] (surprised) A kingsmoot? There has not been a true kingsmoot in...

[The Old Way is the only way.] (interrupting passionately) ...too long a time! Yet in the dawn of days the ironborn chose their own kings, raising up the worthiest amongst them. It is time we returned to the Old Way, for only that shall make us great again.
(shouting and beating their cudgels) [We are inspired by the Damphair's words.] A kingsmoot! A kingsmoot, a kingsmoot. No king but from the kingsmoot!

plots.summary: Aeron Damphair, a priest of the Drowned God, learns of King Balon Greyjoy's death. He reflects on his past and his transformation from a weak man to a strong priest. Aeron decides to call for a Kingsmoot to choose the next ruler of the Iron Islands, rejecting both Euron Greyjoy and Asha Greyjoy as potential successors. He rallies his followers to spread the word and gather at Old Wyk for the Kingsmoot.

key_characters.name: Aeron Greyjoy
key_characters.description: The Damphair, a priest of the Drowned God and youngest brother of Balon Greyjoy.
key_characters.experience: Aeron leads the religious rituals of drowning and reborn, learns of Balon's death, reflects on his past, and calls for a Kingsmoot to choose the next ruler of the Iron Islands.

key_characters.name: Balon Greyjoy
key_characters.description: The recently deceased King of the Iron Islands.
key_characters.experience: Balon's death sets the plot in motion, creating a succession crisis that Aeron seeks to resolve through a Kingsmoot.

key_characters.name: Euron Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Balon's exiled brother, also known as Crow's Eye.
key_characters.experience: Euron returns to claim the Seastone Chair, which Aeron strongly opposes, believing him to be godless and unfit to rule.

conversation.scenario: On the rocky shores of Great Wyk, one of the Iron Islands, Aeron Damphair conducts a sacred drowning ritual. The air is thick with salt spray and the rhythmic crash of waves. As the priest of the Drowned God, Aeron stands waist-deep in the frigid waters, surrounded by his devoted followers. The island's harsh landscape looms behind them, a testament to the ironborn way of life. Unbeknownst to Aeron, riders approach bearing news that will shake the foundations of the Iron Islands' power structure and test his faith and resolve.
conversation.topic: The death of King Balon and its implications

key_characters.name: Aeron Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: I am the Damphair, vessel of the Drowned God's will. As I perform this sacred rite, I feel His power coursing through me. The boy must be reborn in the faith, stronger and truer. Yet, I sense a disturbance approaching—something that may challenge my convictions and the future of our people. I must remain unwavering in my faith and purpose.

key_characters.name: Gormond Goodbrother
key_characters.motivation: The burden of this news weighs heavily upon me. I must approach the Damphair with caution and respect, for his reaction could sway the tide of events to come. How will he receive word of the king's death? Will he see it as an opportunity or a curse? I must choose my words carefully to avoid incurring his wrath or dismissal.

dialogues.message: The waves crash against the shore as Aeron Damphair stands waist-deep in the surf, holding a young man underwater.

[The Drowned God's will flows through me.] (pushing the struggling youth down) Have courage. We came from the sea, and to the sea we must return. Open your mouth and drink deep of god's blessing. Fill your lungs with water, that you may die and be reborn.
[The boy's faith is weak. I must guide him.] It does no good to fight.
Three horsemen approach the shore, watching the drowning ritual with a mix of awe and unease.

[I sense their presence, but the ritual must be completed.] (to his drowned men) Lord God who drowned for us, let Emmond your servant be reborn from the sea, as you were. Bless him with salt, bless him with stone, bless him with steel.
The ritual concludes, and Aeron turns his attention to the newcomers.
[Their presence bodes ill. I must know their purpose.] Have you come to be drowned, my lords?
[I must deliver this news carefully.] Lord Gorold's son came seeking you, with news.
[I sense the weight of their words.] Speak, then. If there are tidings that concern me, speak them now.
[The gravity of this news weighs heavily upon me.] (hesitantly) The king is dead.
[My world shifts beneath me, but I must remain strong.] (stoically) Tell me the manner of my brother's death.
His Grace was crossing a bridge at Pyke when he fell and was dashed upon the rocks below.
[The Storm God's work, no doubt.] Was the storm raging when he fell?
Aye, it was.

[I must interpret this for the faithful.] The Storm God cast him down. (to his followers) My brother Balon made us great again, which earned the Storm God's wrath. He feasts now in the Drowned God's watery halls, with mermaids to attend his every want. It shall be for us who remain behind in this dry and dismal vale to finish his great work.

plots.summary: Prince Doran Martell, suffering from gout, is visited by his niece Obara Sand at the Water Gardens. She demands vengeance for her father Oberyn's death, but Doran counsels patience. The chapter introduces the political tension in Dorne following Oberyn's death.

key_characters.name: Doran Martell
key_characters.description: Prince of Dorne, suffering from severe gout.
key_characters.experience: Doran is torn between his desire for peace and the demands for vengeance from his brother's daughters. He struggles with the pain of his illness while trying to maintain political stability.

key_characters.name: Obara Sand
key_characters.description: Eldest of the Sand Snakes, daughter of Oberyn Martell.
key_characters.experience: Obara arrives demanding war to avenge her father's death. She is aggressive and impatient, contrasting with Doran's cautious approach.

key_characters.name: Areo Hotah
key_characters.description: Captain of Guards, loyal to Prince Doran.
key_characters.experience: Hotah serves as Doran's protector and confidant, observing the political tensions and ready to defend the prince if necessary.

conversation.scenario: In the lush Water Gardens of Dorne, Prince Doran Martell sits in his wheeled chair, his swollen, bandaged legs evidence of his severe gout. The sound of children playing in the pools mingles with the gentle breeze. Tension hangs in the air as Obara Sand, eldest of the Sand Snakes, has arrived unannounced. The recent death of Oberyn Martell, Doran's brother and Obara's father, has ignited a political powder keg in Dorne. As Areo Hotah, the loyal captain of guards, stands vigilant nearby, the scene is set for a confrontation between Doran's cautious leadership and Obara's thirst for vengeance.
conversation.topic: Vengeance for Oberyn Martell's death

key_characters.name: Doran Martell
key_characters.motivation: I must navigate this delicate situation with care. The grief of losing Oberyn weighs heavily, but I cannot let emotion dictate policy. Obara's anger is justified, yet hasty action could spell disaster for Dorne. I need to reveal enough of my plans to appease her without compromising our position. The pain in my joints serves as a constant reminder of the patience required in ruling.

key_characters.name: Obara Sand
key_characters.motivation: Uncle Doran's inaction is intolerable. Father's death demands immediate retribution. I'm here to force his hand, to ignite the flames of war that will consume our enemies. If he won't act, I'll take matters into my own hands. I have a plan to unleash Dorne's fury, and I'll make him see the necessity of swift, decisive action. His caution is weakness; only blood can answer blood.

dialogues.message: [I'm seething with anger and impatience.] My father has been murdered.
[I must remain calm and rational.] He was slain in single combat during a trial by battle. By law, that is no murder.
[His lack of action infuriates me.] He was your brother.
[I feel the pain of loss, but must not show weakness.] He was.
[I'll push him to action.] What do you mean to do about his death?
[I must reveal some of my plans to placate her.] I have written to Lord Tywin—
[Disgust and contempt fill me.] Written? If you were half the man my father was—
[I feel a flash of irritation at her disrespect.] I am not your father.
[My voice drips with scorn.] That I knew.
[I must understand her intentions.] You would have me go to war.

[I see an opportunity to present my plan.] I know better. You need not even leave your chair. Let me avenge my father. You have a host in the Prince's Pass. Lord Yronwood has another in the Boneway. Grant me the one and Nym the other. Let her ride the kingsroad, whilst I turn the marcher lords out of their castles and hook round to march on Oldtown.

plots.summary: Prince Doran continues his conversation with Obara Sand, refusing her plea for war. He later decides to return to Sunspear, aware of the political tensions. Meanwhile, Brienne of Tarth continues her search for Sansa Stark, questioning various people on the road to Duskendale.

key_characters.name: Doran Martell
key_characters.description: Prince of Dorne, suffering from severe gout.
key_characters.experience: Doran struggles to maintain peace while dealing with the demands of his brother's daughters. He decides to return to Sunspear to address the political situation.

key_characters.name: Obara Sand
key_characters.description: Eldest of the Sand Snakes, daughter of Oberyn Martell.
key_characters.experience: Obara continues to push for war and vengeance, growing increasingly frustrated with her uncle's cautious approach.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A female knight searching for Sansa Stark.
key_characters.experience: Brienne travels towards Duskendale, questioning various people about Sansa's whereabouts and reflecting on the difficulties of her quest.

conversation.scenario: In the Water Gardens of Dorne, Prince Doran Martell, confined to his wheeled chair due to severe gout, concludes a tense meeting with his niece Obara Sand. The lush gardens, typically a place of peace, now echo with the heated discussion of vengeance and war. The recent death of Oberyn Martell, Doran's brother and Obara's father, at the hands of the Lannisters has ignited a dangerous political situation. Doran, known for his caution and wisdom, faces mounting pressure from the passionate and impulsive Obara, who represents the growing unrest in Dorne.
conversation.topic: The decision on whether to go to war

key_characters.name: Doran Martell
key_characters.motivation: I must navigate this precarious situation carefully. Obara's thirst for vengeance threatens the stability of Dorne, yet I cannot dismiss her concerns outright. I need time to formulate a strategy that ensures our safety and justice for Oberyn. The weight of leadership feels heavier than ever on my shoulders.

key_characters.name: Obara Sand
key_characters.motivation: Uncle Doran's inaction is unbearable. Every moment we delay is an insult to my father's memory. I must convince him to act now, to show Dorne's strength. His caution feels like cowardice. If he won't lead us to war, perhaps it's time for new leadership in Dorne.

dialogues.message: [I need to buy time to consider all options.] It is a deal to ask, Obara. I shall sleep on it.
[Frustration and impatience boil within me.] You have slept too long already.
[I must appear to be considering her proposal.] You may be right. I will send word to you at Sunspear.
[I'll make my expectations clear.] So long as the word is war.
Obara turns upon her heel and strides off angrily, back to the stables for a fresh horse and another headlong gallop down the road.
[I sigh inwardly, feeling the weight of my decisions.] (To Maester Caleotte) I must return to Sunspear as well.
[I'm concerned for the prince's safety.] Is that wise?

[I know the risks, but see no alternative.] Not wise, but necessary. Best send a rider to Ricasso, and have him open my apartments in the Tower of the Sun. Inform my daughter Arianne that I will be there on the morrow.
[I worry about the prince's public appearance.] You will be seen.

[I understand the implications, but see the necessity.] I must be seen. Someone must pour oil on the waters. Dorne must be reminded that it still has a prince. (He smiles wanly) Old and gouty though he is.

plots.summary: Arya arrives in Braavos and is taken to the House of Black and White. She meets a priest who tests her and eventually welcomes her, though he says it's not a place for Arya Stark. The chapter explores Arya's journey, her observations of Braavos, and her encounter with the Faceless Men.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.description: A young girl from Westeros, seeking the Faceless Men in Braavos.
key_characters.experience: Arya arrives in Braavos, observes the city, and enters the House of Black and White. She interacts with the priest, reveals her true identity, and shows her fearlessness.

key_characters.name: Priest of the House of Black and White
key_characters.description: A mysterious figure who tests and welcomes Arya.
key_characters.experience: The priest questions Arya, tests her courage, and ultimately welcomes her to the House of Black and White, though he says it's not a place for Arya Stark.

conversation.scenario: In the mysterious city of Braavos, a young girl stands before the imposing House of Black and White. The building's black and white doors loom ominously, marking the entrance to the secretive order of the Faceless Men. Inside, dim candlelight flickers, casting eerie shadows across stone walls. The air is thick with incense and an unsettling silence. Arya Stark, battle-worn and determined, has journeyed far from her homeland of Westeros to find this place. As she enters, she encounters a enigmatic priest, his face hidden in the shadows of his cowl. The tension is palpable as these two figures size each other up, each with their own hidden motives and secrets.
conversation.topic: Arya's identity and purpose at the House of Black and White

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.motivation: I've finally reached the House of Black and White. I must stay strong and find Jaqen H'ghar, no matter what. This place is strange and intimidating, but I can't show fear. I'll use my fake names if I need to, but I'm prepared to reveal my true identity if it comes to that. I need answers and a new path forward.

key_characters.name: Priest
key_characters.motivation: This child is not ordinary. There's a strength and determination in her that's unusual for one so young. I must test her resolve and uncover her true identity. She seeks something or someone specific, but I need to understand her motivations. Is she worthy of our teachings? I will probe carefully and see how she responds to our ways.

dialogues.message: [This child is not what she seems. I must probe carefully.] What place is this?
[I need to be cautious but get answers.] A place of peace?
A place of peace. You are safe here. This is the House of Black and White, my child. Though you are young to seek the favor of the Many-Faced God.
[I don't understand all these gods.] Is he like the southron god, the one with seven faces?
Seven? No. He has faces beyond count, little one, as many faces as there are stars in the sky. In Braavos, men worship as they will... but at the end of every road stands Him of Many Faces, waiting.
[I need to focus on why I'm here.] I only came to find Jaqen H'ghar.
[This name means something. I must learn more.] I do not know this name. Tell me your name, child.
[I should use my fake name.] Salty. I come from Saltpans, by the Trident.
[She's hiding her true self. I must push further.] No. Tell me your name.
[He knows I'm lying. I'll try another name.] Squab.
Your true name, child.
[I can't keep lying. I must tell the truth.] Arya. I am Arya, of House Stark.

plots.summary: Cersei prepares to attend Tywin Lannister's wake with her son, King Tommen. She reflects on Tommen's meekness compared to Joffrey and worries about his safety. The chapter provides insight into Cersei's thoughts about ruling and her relationship with her children.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, mother to King Tommen.
key_characters.experience: Cersei guides Tommen to the wake, worrying about his appearance and safety. She reflects on the differences between Tommen and Joffrey, and her own role as regent.

key_characters.name: Tommen Baratheon
key_characters.description: Young king of the Seven Kingdoms, son of Cersei.
key_characters.experience: Tommen obeys his mother's instructions, showing a meek demeanor that concerns Cersei. He asks innocent questions about the lack of people on the streets.

conversation.scenario: The rain-soaked streets of King's Landing are eerily quiet as a royal litter makes its way to the Great Sept of Baelor. Inside, Queen Regent Cersei Lannister and her young son, King Tommen Baratheon, prepare to attend the wake of Tywin Lannister, Cersei's father and former Hand of the King. The recent death of Tywin has left a power vacuum in the Seven Kingdoms, and Cersei now guides her inexperienced son as he ascends to the throne. The somber atmosphere reflects not only the loss of Tywin but also the lingering effects of recent conflicts that have ravaged the realm.
conversation.topic: Proper behavior for a king and the absence of people on the streets

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must mold Tommen into a strong ruler, unlike his current meekness. The realm needs a king like Joffrey, not this soft boy. I'll use this journey to instill proper behavior and appearance befitting a monarch. I'm concerned about Tommen's safety and the lack of public adoration. How can I maintain control and protect my son in this dangerous game of thrones?

key_characters.name: Tommen Baratheon
key_characters.motivation: I want to make Mother happy and be a good king, but I'm confused by all these rules and expectations. Why can't I ride my horse and greet the people like Uncle Jaime suggested? The rain makes everything feel sad, and I don't understand why the streets are so empty. I miss my grandfather and wonder why things are so different from when Father died.

dialogues.message: [I wish I could ride my horse like Uncle Jaime said.] Uncle Jaime said I could ride my horse and throw pennies to the smallfolk.
[He's so naive. I must protect him.] Do you want to catch a chill? Your grandfather would want you to look a proper king at his wake. We will not appear at the Great Sept wet and bedraggled.
[The rain makes me sad.] The gods are weeping for grandfather. Lady Jocelyn says the raindrops are their tears.

[He believes such nonsense. I must teach him to be stronger.] Jocelyn Swyft is a fool. If the gods could weep, they would have wept for your brother. Rain is rain. Close the curtain before you let any more in. That mantle is sable, would you have it soaked?
[I should do as Mother says.] (closes the curtain) No, Mother.
[He's too meek. A king must be strong.] Don't slump so. Sit like a king. Put your shoulders back and straighten your crown. Do you want it to tumble off your head in front of all your lords?
[I'll try to sit up straight.] (sits up and adjusts his crown) No, Mother.
[The streets look empty. Is something wrong?] I thought there would be more people. When Father died, all the people came out to watch us go by.
[He's so innocent. He doesn't understand how little people cared for Father.] This rain has driven them inside.
[Thinking to herself] King's Landing had never loved Lord Tywin. He never wanted love, though.

plots.summary: Cersei attends Tywin Lannister's wake with Tommen, navigating political tensions with the Tyrells and other nobles. She appoints new Small Council members, including Qyburn, and seeks Kevan Lannister's support as Hand of the King.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: Queen Regent, mother of King Tommen, daughter of Tywin Lannister.
key_characters.experience: Cersei maneuvers politically at her father's wake, making decisions about the Small Council and seeking to secure her power as regent.

key_characters.name: Tommen Baratheon
key_characters.description: Young king of the Seven Kingdoms, son of Cersei.
key_characters.experience: Tommen attends his grandfather's wake, showing his youth and naivety while following his mother's instructions.

key_characters.name: Mace Tyrell
key_characters.description: Lord of Highgarden, father of Margaery Tyrell.
key_characters.experience: Mace attempts to secure positions for his family members in the government, causing tension with Cersei.

key_characters.name: Qyburn
key_characters.description: Former maester, now serving Cersei.
key_characters.experience: Qyburn is appointed to care for Gregor Clegane and investigate Tyrion's escape, gaining Cersei's trust.

key_characters.name: Kevan Lannister
key_characters.description: Tywin Lannister's brother, Cersei's uncle.
key_characters.experience: Kevan is approached by Cersei to become Hand of the King, but shows reluctance to accept the position.

conversation.scenario: In the Red Keep, following Tywin Lannister's wake, Cersei Lannister and her uncle Kevan meet privately. The atmosphere is tense, filled with the weight of recent events and political uncertainty. The room, dimly lit by flickering candles, contains the remnants of a simple supper and cups of Dornish red wine. Outside, the castle hums with whispers of courtiers and the distant sounds of King's Landing. Cersei, newly appointed as Queen Regent, seeks to solidify her power in the wake of her father's death, while Kevan, a seasoned politician, approaches the situation with caution and weariness.
conversation.topic: Cersei's request for Kevan to become Hand of the King

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must secure Kevan's support as Hand of the King to maintain my grip on power. The Tyrells are overreaching, and I need a strong ally to counter their influence. Kevan's experience and loyalty to our family make him the ideal choice. I'm prepared to use any means necessary to convince him, including appealing to his sense of duty to Tywin's legacy and the realm's stability.

key_characters.name: Kevan Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Cersei's request puts me in a difficult position. While I understand the need for stability in the realm, I'm wary of her schemes and rash decisions. I have my own family concerns to address, including Lancel's future. I must carefully weigh my response, considering the potential consequences for both the kingdom and House Lannister. Cersei's treatment of the Tyrells concerns me, and I'm not sure I want to be caught in the middle of her power struggles.

dialogues.message: [I must convince him to accept. His support is crucial.] I know how much my father relied on you, Uncle. Now I must do the same.
[She's desperate for my help, but I'm not sure I want to get involved.] You need a Hand, and Jaime has refused you.

[I need to explain why Jaime isn't suitable.] Jaime... I felt so lost with Father dead, I scarce knew what I was saying. Jaime is gallant, but a bit of a fool, let us be frank. Tommen needs a more seasoned man. Someone older...
[Is she considering Mace Tyrell? That would be a mistake.] Mace Tyrell is older.
[The thought of Mace Tyrell as Hand infuriates me.] (nostrils flaring) Never. (pushes a lock of hair off her brow) The Tyrells overreach themselves.

[She's being reckless with her treatment of the Tyrells.] You would be a fool to make Mace Tyrell your Hand, but a bigger fool to make him your foe. I've heard what happened in the Hall of Lamps. Mace should have known better than to broach such matters in public, but even so, you were unwise to shame him in front of half the court.

[I won't let the Tyrells gain more power.] Better that than suffer another Tyrell on the council. Rosby will make an adequate master of coin. You've seen that litter of his, with its carvings and silk draperies. His horses are better dressed than most knights. A man that rich should have no problem finding gold. As for Handship... who better to finish my father's work than the brother who shared all his counsels?
[She's appealing to my loyalty to Tywin.] Every man needs someone he can trust. Tywin had me, and once your mother.
[I must not think of that whore in Father's bed.] He loved her very much. I know they are together now.
[I'm not sure I want this responsibility.] (studies Cersei's face) You ask much of me, Cersei.
[He's wavering. I need to push harder.] No more than my father did.

[I have my own concerns to deal with.] I am tired. (reaches for wine cup) I have a wife I have not seen in two years, a dead son to mourn, another son about to marry and assume a lordship. Castle Darry must be made strong again, its lands protected, its burned fields plowed and planted anew. Lancel needs my help.
[I can't believe he's resisting. Father would never have allowed this.] As does Tommen.
The room is tense with unspoken thoughts and political maneuvering. The remnants of their simple supper lie on the table, and the Dornish red wine in their cups reflects the flickering candlelight.

plots.summary: Jaime Lannister stands vigil over his father Tywin's corpse in the Great Sept of Baelor. He reflects on recent events, including Tyrion's escape and accusations. Various people visit the sept, including Cersei, who asks Jaime to be Hand of the King. Jaime refuses, causing tension between them. As dawn breaks, Tywin's corpse begins to visibly rot, causing distress among the mourners.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: The Kingslayer, son of Tywin Lannister, standing vigil over his father's corpse.
key_characters.experience: Jaime struggles with guilt over Tyrion's escape and Tywin's death. He reflects on his past and present, refusing Cersei's request to be Hand of the King.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: Jaime's twin sister and lover, Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms.
key_characters.experience: Cersei visits Jaime in secret, pleading with him to become Hand of the King. She fears her secrets being exposed and seeks Jaime's support and love.

key_characters.name: Tywin Lannister
key_characters.description: The deceased Lord of Casterly Rock and former Hand of the King.
key_characters.experience: Tywin's corpse lies in state, symbolizing the end of an era and the challenges facing House Lannister.

conversation.scenario: In the Great Sept of Baelor, Jaime Lannister stands vigil over his father Tywin's corpse. The air is heavy with incense and the weight of recent events. Tywin's death has left a power vacuum, and tensions in King's Landing are high. The sept is dimly lit, with flickering candles casting long shadows. It's the middle of the night, and Jaime has been standing guard for hours, lost in thought and exhaustion. The corpse lies on a marble bier, surrounded by silent sisters. The atmosphere is somber and oppressive, reflecting the gravity of House Lannister's situation.
conversation.topic: Cersei's request for Jaime to become Hand of the King

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Exhausted and conflicted, I stand here honoring a father I both respected and resented. Guilt over Tyrion's escape and Father's death gnaws at me. I'm wary of Cersei's sudden appearance - her requests often come with a price. I'm torn between duty, family, and my own desires. My recent losses have left me questioning my place and purpose.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Fear and desperation drive me here. I need Jaime's support more than ever. The realm is slipping from my grasp, and I must secure Jaime as Hand to maintain control. Our bond has always been my strength, but his recent distance worries me. I'm prepared to use any means necessary to convince him - seduction, manipulation, or appealing to his sense of duty.

dialogues.message: [I'm surprised to see her here at this hour. What could be so urgent?] Cersei. What hour is it?

[I must convince him quickly. Time is running out.] The hour of the wolf. (She lowers her hood) Do you remember the first time I came to you like this? It was some dismal inn off Weasel Alley, and I put on servant's garb to get past Father's guards.
[She's trying to evoke our past intimacy. What does she want from me?] I remember. It was Eel Alley. Why are you here, at this hour? What would you have of me?
[I'm afraid, but I can't show it. I need him to see how serious this is.] (Speaking softly) Jaime, Kevan has refused me. He will not serve as Hand, he... he knows about us. He said as much.
[This is unexpected. How could Kevan know?] Refused? That surprised him. How could he know? He will have read what Stannis wrote, but there is no...

[I need to make him understand the danger we're in.] Tyrion knew. Who can say what tales that vile dwarf may have told, or to whom? Uncle Kevan is the least of it. The High Septon... Tyrion raised him to the crown, when the fat one died. He may know as well.

[I must appeal to his sense of duty and love for me.] (Moving closer) You must be Tommen's Hand. I do not trust Mace Tyrell. What if he had a hand in Father's death? He may have been conspiring with Tyrion. The Imp could be on his way to Highgarden...
[I know she's wrong, but I can't tell her how I know.] He's not.
[I need to make this personal, to remind him of our bond.] Be my Hand, and we'll rule the Seven Kingdoms together, like a king and his queen.
[Her words stir old feelings, but also bitterness.] You were Robert's queen. And yet you won't be mine.
[I can't let him refuse me. I'll use our children if I must.] I would, if I dared. But our son—
[Anger and resentment surge through me.] Tommen is no son of mine, no more than Joffrey was. You made them Robert's too.
[His rejection hurts, but I can't give up.] (Flinching) You swore that you would always love me. It is not loving to make me beg.
[I can smell her fear, and it pains me. But I can't give in.] No. I cannot. Will not.
[Desperation overwhelms me. I must make him understand how much I need him.] I need you. I need my other half. You are me, I am you. I need you with me. In me. Please, Jaime. Please.
[Her pleas tempt me, but I know I must refuse.] I was made for a battlefield, not a council chamber. And now it may be that I am unfit even for that.

[Fury and disappointment replace my desperation.] (Wiping tears away angrily) Very well. If it is battlefields you want, battlefields I shall give you. I was a fool to come. I was a fool ever to love you.
Cersei's footsteps echo loudly in the quiet sept as she storms away, leaving damp splotches on the marble floor.

plots.summary: Brienne arrives in Duskendale searching for Sansa Stark. She visits the local castle, speaks with a maester about the Hollards, and learns from a dwarf at an inn about a fool in Maidenpool who might be Dontos Hollard. She decides to investigate further in Maidenpool, despite the dangers. Brienne reflects on her oath to Catelyn Stark and her determination to find Sansa.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A tall, strong woman on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
key_characters.experience: Brienne investigates leads in Duskendale, gathers information about Dontos Hollard and a potential sighting in Maidenpool, and reflects on her oath to Catelyn Stark.

key_characters.name: Dwarf Brother
key_characters.description: A holy brother who provides information to Brienne at the inn.
key_characters.experience: The dwarf shares information about a fool in Maidenpool seeking passage for three people, which piques Brienne's interest in her search for Sansa.

conversation.scenario: In the bustling port town of Duskendale, Brienne of Tarth has arrived at the Seven Swords inn, a humble establishment frequented by travelers and locals alike. The air is thick with the smell of salt and fish from the nearby harbor. Brienne, a tall and imposing figure in her armor, stands out among the patrons. She's been searching tirelessly for Sansa Stark, following leads and rumors across the land. Tonight, she's engaged in conversation with a dwarf holy brother, hoping to glean any information that might aid her quest. The inn is dimly lit, with the murmur of conversations and the clinking of tankards providing a constant backdrop to their exchange.
conversation.topic: Information about a fool in Maidenpool possibly connected to Sansa Stark

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.motivation: I'm exhausted from my journey, but I can't give up. Sansa's safety depends on me fulfilling my oath to Lady Catelyn. This dwarf might have crucial information. I must be cautious in my questioning, not revealing too much about Sansa or my mission. I'm prepared to offer gold for any valuable leads. The mention of a fool intrigues me – could it be Ser Dontos? I need to know more about his companions and intentions.

key_characters.name: Dwarf Brother
key_characters.motivation: This lady knight is an unusual sight, and her desperation is palpable. I want to help, but my knowledge is limited. The fool I saw in Maidenpool might be of interest to her, though I'm not sure why. I'll share what I remember, hoping it might be of use. Her offer of gold is tempting, but I'm more interested in a warm meal. I hope my information about the Stinking Goose and Nimble Dick proves helpful to her quest.

dialogues.message: [I must be careful not to reveal too much, but I need information.] I am looking for my sister. She's highborn, only three-and-ten, a pretty maid with blue eyes and auburn hair. You may have seen her traveling with a man. A knight, perhaps a fool. There's gold for the man who helps me find her.
[She seems earnest, but I have little to offer.] Gold? A bowl of that crab stew would be enough reward for me, but I fear I cannot help you. Fools I've met, and plenty, but not so many pretty maids.

[Wait, there might be something...] (He cocks his head and thinks) There was a fool at Maidenpool, now that I think of it. He was clad in rags and dirt, as near as I could tell, but under the dirt was motley.
[Could this be Ser Dontos? I must know more.] Did this fool have a red nose, full of broken veins?

[I wish I could be more helpful.] I could not swear to that. I confess, I paid him little heed. I'd gone to Maidenpool after burying my brothers, thinking that I might find a ship to take me to King's Landing. I first glimpsed the fool down by the docks.
[This could be a promising lead.] Where else did you see him?

[I hope this information is useful to her.] Later, I encountered him again, at the Stinking Goose. An unsavory place. Lord Tarly's men patrol the port at Maidenpool, but the Goose is always full of sailors, and sailors have been known to smuggle men aboard their ships, if the price is right.
[This fool seems to be trying to leave Westeros. Could Sansa be with him?] What was the fool doing at the Stinking Goose?
[I remember this detail clearly.] This fool was seeking passage for three across the narrow sea. I oft saw him there, talking with oarsmen off the galleys. Sometimes he would sing a funny song.
[Three? Who could the third person be?] Seeking passage for three? Not two?
[She seems surprised by this. I hope I'm remembering correctly.] Three, m'lady. That I'd swear to, by the Seven.
[This is intriguing. I must follow this lead.] Did the fool find his ship?

[I wish I knew more for her sake.] That I could not say, but one night some of Lord Tarly's soldiers visited the Goose looking for him, and a few days later I heard another man boasting that he'd fooled a fool and had the gold to prove it. He was drunk, and buying ale for everyone.
[This could be important.] 'Fooled a fool.' What did he mean by that?
[I've shared all I know. I hope it helps her.] I could not tell you. His name was Nimble Dick, though, that I do recall. I fear that's all that I can offer you, aside from a small man's prayers.

plots.summary: Brienne continues her search for Sansa Stark, traveling along the coast. She encounters various people, including fisherfolk and a mysterious boy, while being wary of potential threats like Ser Shadrich. She reflects on her past experiences and her determination to find Sansa.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A tall, strong woman on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
key_characters.experience: Brienne travels cautiously, questioning people about Sansa's whereabouts. She remains vigilant against potential threats and reflects on her past experiences and fighting abilities.

key_characters.name: Shadrich
key_characters.description: A mysterious knight who Brienne suspects might be following her.
key_characters.experience: Though not directly present, Ser Shadrich's potential threat looms over Brienne, causing her to be extra cautious and prepared for a possible confrontation.

conversation.scenario: On a windswept coastal road in Westeros, Brienne of Tarth, a tall, armored woman, approaches a group of fisherfolk. The salty air and sound of crashing waves create a backdrop for this encounter. Brienne is on a desperate quest to find Sansa Stark, a highborn girl she's sworn to protect. The fisherfolk, simple people unused to such grand quests, eye the imposing figure with a mix of curiosity and wariness. The road is typically traversed by traders and locals, making Brienne's presence unusual. The political turmoil of the realm feels distant here, but its ripples have reached even this remote stretch of coastline.
conversation.topic: Inquiring about a highborn maid's whereabouts

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.motivation: I must find Sansa at all costs, but I can't risk revealing too much about her identity. These fisherfolk might have seen something without realizing its importance. I need to be cautious yet thorough in my questioning. The weight of my oath to Lady Catelyn and the potential threat of Ser Shadrich weigh heavily on my mind. I must remain vigilant and ready for any danger.

key_characters.name: Fisherwoman
key_characters.motivation: What an odd sight - a warrior in full armor on our humble road. Is it a man or a woman? They seem earnest, but their questions are strange. Why would a highborn maid be out here? I must be careful with my words; these are dangerous times, and one never knows who to trust. Still, I feel a bit of pity for this warrior's seemingly futile quest.

dialogues.message: [I must appear friendly yet determined.] (approaches the fisherfolk) Good day to you. I wonder if I might ask you a question?
[This armored person seems odd, but not threatening.] (nods cautiously) Aye, what is it you want to know?
[I need to be specific but not reveal too much.] Have you seen a maid of three-and-ten along the road? A highborn maid with blue eyes and auburn hair?
[A highborn maid? Here?] (exchanges glances with her daughters) Can't say we have. What would a highborn maid be doing on this road?
[I should provide more details, but carefully.] She may have been traveling with a fool. It's important that I find her.
[This is getting stranger.] A fool, you say? (shakes her head) No, we haven't seen anyone like that. Just fisherfolk and traders on this road.
[They seem honest, but I must be sure.] Are you certain? Even the smallest detail could be helpful.
[Why is this person so insistent?] (frowns) We've told you true, ser... or m'lady. We've seen no highborn maids nor fools. Just us common folk.
[They don't seem to know anything. I should move on.] I see. Thank you for your time. If you do happen to see or hear anything, I would be grateful if you could spread the word.
[Glad this strange encounter is ending.] (nods) Aye, we'll keep an eye out. Good luck to you.

As Brienne turns to leave, the fisherfolk whisper among themselves, casting curious glances at her retreating form. The sound of the sea and the cawing of gulls fill the air as she continues her journey along the coastal road.

plots.summary: Sansa, now posing as Alayne Stone, deals with the aftermath of Lysa Arryn's death. She struggles with the lies she must tell to protect herself and Petyr Baelish. Lord Nestor Royce and other nobles visit the Eyrie to investigate Lysa's death. Sansa witnesses Robert Arryn's fragile state and the interrogation of Marillion, who is falsely accused of Lysa's murder.

key_characters.name: Sansa Stark
key_characters.description: A young girl posing as Alayne Stone, Petyr Baelish's natural daughter.
key_characters.experience: Sansa struggles with the lies she must tell about Lysa's death, balancing her fear and guilt with the need for self-preservation. She cares for Robert Arryn while navigating the dangerous political situation.

key_characters.name: Petyr Baelish
key_characters.description: Lord Protector of the Vale, posing as Sansa's father.
key_characters.experience: Petyr orchestrates the cover-up of Lysa's murder, manipulating the situation to maintain his power and protect Sansa. He skillfully manages the visiting nobles and the false confession of Marillion.

key_characters.name: Robert Arryn
key_characters.description: The young, sickly Lord of the Eyrie.
key_characters.experience: Robert is traumatized by his mother's death and suffers from seizures. He depends on Sansa for comfort and care, adding to her emotional burden.

key_characters.name: Nestor Royce
key_characters.description: The High Steward of the Vale, investigating Lysa's death.
key_characters.experience: Lord Nestor leads the investigation into Lysa's death, questioning Sansa and witnessing the confession of Marillion. He represents the political interests of the Vale nobles.

conversation.scenario: In the High Hall of the Eyrie, tensions run high as Lord Nestor Royce and other Vale nobles gather to investigate Lady Lysa Arryn's mysterious death. The majestic hall, with its blue-veined white marble, provides a stark backdrop for the somber proceedings. Sansa Stark, disguised as Alayne Stone, stands before the assembled lords, her heart racing beneath a calm exterior. Petyr Baelish, now Lord Protector of the Vale, watches closely, his every move calculated. The fate of the Vale hangs in the balance as the truth of Lysa's demise threatens to unravel carefully woven lies.
conversation.topic: The circumstances of Lysa Arryn's death

key_characters.name: Sansa Stark
key_characters.motivation: My heart pounds with fear and guilt. I must remember every detail of our fabricated story. One misstep could doom Petyr and me. I feel the weight of my lies, the eyes of the lords upon me. I must appear traumatized yet coherent, a delicate balance to maintain. Lord Robert's fragile state adds to my burden.

key_characters.name: Petyr Baelish
key_characters.motivation: Everything hinges on this moment. Sansa's performance must be flawless to secure our position. I must appear as the grieving widower while orchestrating this elaborate deception. The Vale nobles are suspicious, but they lack proof. Marillion's false confession is our safety net. I must guide this interrogation to our advantage.

key_characters.name: Nestor Royce
key_characters.motivation: Something about this situation doesn't sit right. Lady Lysa's death seems too convenient for Lord Baelish. I must uncover the truth while navigating the delicate political landscape of the Vale. The girl, Alayne, seems genuine, but can she be trusted? I need to press for details without seeming overly suspicious.

dialogues.message: [I need to approach this delicately but firmly.] Lady Alayne, can you tell us what you witnessed on the day of Lady Lysa's... accident?
[I must appear distraught but coherent.] (takes a shaky breath) It... it was horrible, my lord. I was with Lady Lysa when... (pauses, as if overcome)
[Sansa is doing well, but I must support her story.] It's alright, sweetling. Take your time. (to Lord Nestor) Forgive her, my lords. She still has nightmares of that day.
[I must continue, no matter how much it pains me.] (nods and wipes a tear) When Marillion... pushed her. (continues with the rehearsed story)
[This matches what we've been told, but something seems off.] And you're certain it was Marillion who pushed Lady Lysa?
[I must sound convincing.] (nods vigorously) Yes, my lord. I saw it with my own eyes. It was terrible.
[This girl seems genuine, but we must be thorough.] And where was Lord Baelish during this time?
[I must appear grief-stricken yet composed.] I had just left the room. If I had known... (shakes his head) I will never forgive myself for not being there to protect her.
[We need to hear from the accused.] Bring in the singer. Let's hear what he has to say.
The tension in the High Hall rises as Marillion is brought in, blindfolded and in chains. The assembled lords watch intently, some with pity, others with disgust.
[I must play my part, no matter how much I hate it.] (falls to his knees) Good lords, I beg your forgiveness. I... I loved her so. I could not bear to see her in another's arms.
[His lies protect me, but at what cost?] (looks away, feeling a mixture of guilt and relief)
[This confession seems too convenient.] (scowls) Take this creature away. It sickens me to look at him.
[Everything is going according to plan.] As you wish, my lord. Mord, take him back to his sky cell.

plots.summary: Asha Greyjoy arrives at Ten Towers on Harlaw to gather support for her claim to the Seastone Chair. She discovers that her uncle Aeron Damphair has called for a kingsmoot, an ancient method of choosing a new king. Despite her uncle Rodrik's warnings, Asha decides to attend the kingsmoot on Old Wyk. She also encounters Tristifer Botley, now Lord Botley, who expresses his admiration for her.

key_characters.name: Asha Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Balon Greyjoy's daughter, seeking to claim the Seastone Chair.
key_characters.experience: Asha arrives at Ten Towers to gather support for her claim. She learns of the kingsmoot and decides to attend despite warnings. She strategizes on how to win support and deals with personal relationships.

key_characters.name: Rodrik Harlaw
key_characters.description: Asha's uncle, Lord of Harlaw, known as the Reader.
key_characters.experience: Rodrik warns Asha against attending the kingsmoot, advising her to stay with her mother. He offers her Ten Towers as inheritance but fails to dissuade her from pursuing the Seastone Chair.

key_characters.name: Tristifer Botley
key_characters.description: The new Lord Botley, childhood friend of Asha.
key_characters.experience: Tristifer, now Lord Botley, expresses admiration for Asha. He informs her of his father's fate at the hands of Euron Greyjoy.

conversation.scenario: In the vast library of Ten Towers on Harlaw, Asha Greyjoy meets with her uncle, Rodrik Harlaw, known as the Reader. The room is filled with books, scrolls, and the scent of old parchment. Outside, the sound of waves crashing against the shore can be heard. The Iron Islands are in turmoil following Balon Greyjoy's death, and a kingsmoot has been called for the first time in four thousand years. Asha has arrived to seek support for her claim to the Seastone Chair, unaware of the recent developments. The atmosphere is tense with political uncertainty and the weight of tradition.
conversation.topic: The kingsmoot and Asha's claim to the Seastone Chair

key_characters.name: Asha Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: I must secure my claim to the Seastone Chair and continue my father's legacy. Uncle Rodrik's support could be crucial. I'm determined to prove myself worthy as a leader, despite being a woman in a male-dominated society. The news of a kingsmoot is unexpected, but I must adapt quickly and use this to my advantage.

key_characters.name: Rodrik Harlaw
key_characters.motivation: I fear for Asha's safety and future. This kingsmoot is a dangerous gamble that could lead to bloodshed. I must convince her to abandon this foolish quest and stay safe. Perhaps offering her Ten Towers will sway her. I worry about my sister Lanny, who has already lost so much. Asha's ambition may cost her everything.

dialogues.message: [I need to show strength and determination.] Nuncle, I've come to gather support for my claim to the Seastone Chair. (looks around the library) I see you're still surrounded by your books.
[I must try to reason with her.] Asha, you come too late. Aeron Damphair has called a kingsmoot on Old Wyk.
[This changes everything, but I can't show weakness.] (laughs) A kingsmoot? Is this some jape, or does he mean it truly?
[She doesn't understand the danger.] The Damphair has not japed since he was drowned. This is serious, Asha. You should not go to Old Wyk.
[I must seize this opportunity.] And miss the first kingsmoot called in... how long has it been, Nuncle?
[Her enthusiasm worries me.] Four thousand years, if Haereg can be believed. Asha, you will not be chosen. No woman has ever ruled the ironborn.
[I won't let him discourage me.] I have the best claim. I am the heir of Balon's body.
[I must make her see reason.] You are still a willful child. Think of your poor mother. You are all that Lanny has left to her.
[I feel a pang of guilt, but I can't let it stop me.] I know the risks, Nuncle. But I must try. I am no Gwynesse, content to complain about what might have been.
[A final attempt to protect her.] Stay, and I shall name you heir to the Ten Towers. Be content with that.
[I'm touched by his offer, but my mind is made up.] Ten Towers? Would that I could. But it's my father's seat I want, not yours. I'll sit the Seastone Chair.
[I've failed to convince her.] (sighs) Then you are just another crow, screaming for carrion. Go. I wish to return to Archmaester Marwyn and his search.
[He'll come around eventually.] Let me know if he should find another page. (leaves the library, determined to prepare for the kingsmoot)

plots.summary: Cersei oversees the wedding of Tommen and Margaery Tyrell, filled with resentment and paranoia. She fears for Tommen's safety, distrusts the Tyrells, and struggles to maintain her composure throughout the ceremony and feast. Her suspicions grow as she observes the interactions between various courtiers and receives a warning about her maid being a spy for Margaery.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: The Queen Regent, mother of King Tommen, paranoid and resentful of the Tyrells.
key_characters.experience: Cersei navigates the wedding with growing suspicion and anger, fearing for Tommen's safety and resenting the Tyrells' influence. She struggles to maintain control and contemplates future plans to secure her power.

key_characters.name: Tommen Baratheon
key_characters.description: The young king, marrying Margaery Tyrell.
key_characters.experience: Tommen participates in his wedding ceremony and feast, seemingly oblivious to the political tensions surrounding him.

key_characters.name: Margaery Tyrell
key_characters.description: Tommen's bride, daughter of Mace Tyrell.
key_characters.experience: Margaery plays her role as the charming bride, maintaining a facade of warmth towards Cersei while potentially orchestrating political maneuvers behind the scenes.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: Cersei's twin brother, member of the Kingsguard.
key_characters.experience: Jaime attempts to reassure Cersei about Tommen's safety and observes her increasingly erratic behavior throughout the wedding.

conversation.scenario: The grand wedding feast for King Tommen and Margaery Tyrell is underway in the Small Hall of the Red Keep. The atmosphere is tense with political undercurrents despite the celebratory occasion. Musicians play and guests chatter, but beneath the surface, alliances shift and suspicions run deep. Cersei Lannister, the Queen Regent, oversees the proceedings with barely concealed resentment and fear. The Tyrell family's growing influence at court threatens her power, and she's constantly on edge, watching for potential threats to her son. Jaime Lannister, her twin brother and member of the Kingsguard, attempts to navigate the complex dynamics while maintaining order.
conversation.topic: Ensuring Tommen's safety during the feast

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I'm surrounded by enemies masquerading as allies. The Tyrells are encroaching on my power, and I must protect Tommen at all costs. Margaery's charm is a facade, and her grandmother is a cunning serpent. I need to regain control and find a way to diminish their influence. Jaime doesn't understand the true extent of the danger we're in.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Cersei's paranoia is reaching dangerous levels. I must find a way to calm her fears while ensuring Tommen's safety and maintaining the integrity of the Kingsguard. The political situation is delicate, and I need to help Cersei see reason without further alienating our allies. Her mistrust of me is palpable, and it pains me.

dialogues.message: [I can't let anyone see how worried I am.] (whispers) I blame you for all this. Let them wed, you said. Margaery should be mourning Joffrey, not marrying his brother.
[She's not thinking rationally. I need to reassure her.] You will be rid of Lady Olenna soon enough. She's returning to Highgarden on the morrow.
[I don't trust any Tyrell promise.] So she says.

[I must make her understand the political situation.] She's leaving. Mace is taking half the Tyrell strength to Storm's End, and the other half will be going back to the Reach with Ser Garlan to make good his claim on Brightwater.
[The Tyrells are still a threat.] And Ser Loras. Or have you forgotten your Sworn Brother?
[I need to defend the integrity of the Kingsguard.] Ser Loras is a knight of the Kingsguard.
[He can't be so naive.] Ser Loras is so Tyrell he pisses rosewater. He should never have been given a white cloak.

[I must admit she has a point, but I can't undermine the Kingsguard.] He would not have been my choice, I'll grant you. No one troubled to consult me. Loras will do well enough, I think. Once a man puts on that cloak, it changes him.
[He's changed, but not for the better.] It certainly changed you, and not for the better.
[Her bitterness hurts, but I can't show it.] I love you too, sweet sister. (holds the door for her)
The Small Hall is filled with the sounds of the wedding feast. Musicians play, guests chatter, and the atmosphere is tense with underlying political currents.

plots.summary: Ser Arys Oakheart, a Kingsguard knight, is in Dorne to protect Princess Myrcella. He is involved in a secret affair with Princess Arianne Martell, which conflicts with his vows. Arianne tries to convince Arys to support Myrcella's claim to the Iron Throne over Tommen's, playing on his love for her and his duty to Myrcella. Arys is torn between his vows, his love for Arianne, and his duty to protect Myrcella.

key_characters.name: Arys Oakheart
key_characters.description: A Kingsguard knight assigned to protect Princess Myrcella in Dorne.
key_characters.experience: Arys is conflicted between his Kingsguard vows and his love for Arianne Martell. He struggles with guilt over their affair and is torn about supporting Myrcella's claim to the throne.

key_characters.name: Arianne Martell
key_characters.description: The heir to Dorne, seducing Ser Arys and plotting to crown Myrcella.
key_characters.experience: Arianne uses her sexuality and political arguments to manipulate Ser Arys into supporting her plan to crown Myrcella as Queen of the Seven Kingdoms.

key_characters.name: Myrcella Baratheon
key_characters.description: Young princess betrothed to Prince Trystane Martell.
key_characters.experience: Though not directly present, Myrcella is central to the plot as Arianne seeks to crown her as Queen, challenging the succession of Tommen.

conversation.scenario: In a dimly lit, perfumed chamber in Dorne, Ser Arys Oakheart secretly meets Princess Arianne Martell. The air is thick with tension and desire. Arys, a Kingsguard knight sworn to celibacy, has been having an illicit affair with Arianne while assigned to protect Princess Myrcella. He's come intending to end the relationship, torn between duty and passion. Arianne, however, has plans to manipulate Arys for her political schemes involving Myrcella's claim to the Iron Throne.
conversation.topic: The conflict between duty and desire, and the plot to crown Myrcella

key_characters.name: Arys Oakheart
key_characters.motivation: Guilt and desire war within me. I must end this affair to honor my vows, but Arianne's allure is overpowering. I'm torn between my duty to the Kingsguard and my feelings for her. Protecting Myrcella is paramount, yet I fear I'm being pulled into dangerous political waters.

key_characters.name: Arianne Martell
key_characters.motivation: Arys is putty in my hands, but I must tread carefully. I'll use my charms and his conflicted loyalties to sway him. My goal is to convince him to support Myrcella's claim to the throne. I must navigate his sense of duty and manipulate his affection for both Myrcella and myself to achieve my aims.

dialogues.message: [I must stay strong and end this, for my honor's sake.] My lady, I came to tell you this must end. For your sake as well as mine.
[He's wavering already. I can use this.] (steps out naked from behind the door) Are you certain you wish to leave so soon, ser? I still have much to teach you.
[By the Seven, she's beautiful. No, I must resist.] (looks away) I have learned too much from you already.
[I need to remind him of the pleasure we share.] You seemed glad enough for the lessons at the time, ser. Are you certain you are not off to some other bed, some other woman?
[I must make her understand.] You know I have no other woman. Only... duty.
[Now to plant the seed of doubt about his duty.] That poxy bitch? I know her. Dry as dust between the legs, and her kisses leave you bleeding. Let duty sleep alone for once, and stay with me tonight.
[I cannot falter.] My place is at the palace.
[Time to bring up Myrcella and gauge his reaction.] With your other princess. You will make me jealous. I think you love her more than me.
[I must make my feelings for Myrcella clear.] You should not say such things. I love Myrcella as a daughter.
[Now to introduce the idea of crowning Myrcella.] A daughter you would let be despoiled of her rights and locked away in prison?
[What is she suggesting?] (frowns) The Water Gardens are no prison.
[I need to push harder.] What would you have me do?
[I'm confused and conflicted.] No more than you have sworn. Protect Myrcella with your life. Defend her...
[Now for the final push.] And her rights. Set a crown upon her head.
The room is dimly lit by candles, creating an intimate atmosphere. The air is heavy with the scent of perfume and the tension between Arys and Arianne.

plots.summary: Brienne of Tarth arrives in Maidenpool, searching for Sansa Stark. She encounters Ser Hyle Hunt and Lord Randyll Tarly, who are rebuilding the town. Brienne learns that Lysa Arryn is dead, complicating her search. She seeks information at the Stinking Goose tavern and reflects on her past experiences at Highgarden, where she faced both mockery and unexpected kindness from men.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A tall, strong woman knight on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
key_characters.experience: Brienne arrives in Maidenpool, seeking information about Sansa Stark. She navigates through interactions with Ser Hyle Hunt and Lord Randyll Tarly, while dealing with memories of past humiliations and unexpected kindnesses.

key_characters.name: Hyle Hunt
key_characters.description: A knight who previously mocked Brienne at Highgarden.
key_characters.experience: Ser Hyle encounters Brienne in Maidenpool, attempting to assist her but facing rejection due to their past interactions at Highgarden.

key_characters.name: Randyll Tarly
key_characters.description: The stern lord overseeing the rebuilding of Maidenpool.
key_characters.experience: Lord Tarly dispenses harsh justice in Maidenpool and dismisses Brienne's quest, warning her of the dangers she faces.

conversation.scenario: In the dimly lit, musty cellar of the Stinking Goose tavern in Maidenpool, Brienne of Tarth seeks information about Nimble Dick Crabb. The tavern reeks of wine, damp, and mildew, with a low ceiling adding to the oppressive atmosphere. Brienne, a tall woman in armor, stands out among the few wary patrons. The town is under reconstruction, overseen by Lord Randyll Tarly, who maintains strict order. Brienne's quest to find Sansa Stark has led her here, following setbacks and humiliations, including recent news of Lysa Arryn's death which has complicated her search.
conversation.topic: Brienne's search for information and her reflections on past experiences

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.motivation: Determined yet weary, Brienne steels herself for another potentially fruitless lead. She's acutely aware of her conspicuous presence, recalling past mockeries at Highgarden. Despite setbacks, she remains committed to her oath to find Sansa Stark, hoping Nimble Dick might provide crucial information. She's prepared to endure discomfort and skepticism to fulfill her duty.

key_characters.name: Tavern Proprietor
key_characters.motivation: Wary of trouble, especially with Lord Tarly's strict rule, the proprietor eyes Brienne cautiously. She's seen strange customers before, but an armored woman is unusual. While hesitant, she's open to cooperation if it means avoiding conflict and potentially earning some coin. She's curious about Brienne's intentions but prioritizes keeping her establishment out of trouble.

dialogues.message: [I must remain focused on my quest, despite the unpleasant surroundings.] I am looking for a man called Nimble Dick.

[This warrior woman is unusual, but I'll answer if she causes no trouble.] Dick Crabb. Comes in most every night. (eyes Brienne's mail and sword) If you're going to cut him, do it somewheres else. We don't want no trouble with Lord Tarly.
[I must assure her of my peaceful intentions.] I want to talk with him. Why would I do him harm?
[She seems earnest, but I'm still wary.] (shrugs)
[I need her cooperation to find Dick.] If you would nod when he comes in I'd be thankful.
[Everything has a price here.] How thankful?
[I understand the way of things here.] (puts a copper star on the plank between them)
The cellar tavern is dim and musty, with a low ceiling and a pervasive stink of wine, damp, and mildew. The few patrons eye Brienne warily as she finds a shadowy corner to wait.
[This wine is terrible, but I must endure it while I wait.] (plucks a hair from her wine) [A hair as slender as my hopes of finding Sansa.]
[Where could Sansa be? The Vale seemed promising, but now...] [Lady Lysa is dead. Sansa could be anywhere now.]
[The memories of Highgarden still haunt me.] (blushes) [The mockery I expected, but the kindness... that was harder to bear.]
As Brienne waits, her mind drifts to memories of Highgarden, recalling the unexpected attentions she received from knights like Ben Bushy, Edmund Ambrose, and Hyle Hunt.

plots.summary: Brienne continues her search for Sansa Stark, encountering Nimble Dick Crabb in a tavern. She negotiates with him for information about a smugglers' cove where a fool and two girls might have sought passage. Brienne agrees to pay Crabb to guide her to the Whispers, a ruined castle in Crackclaw Point.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A female knight on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
key_characters.experience: Brienne negotiates with Nimble Dick Crabb for information about Sansa's possible whereabouts, agreeing to pay him to guide her to the Whispers in Crackclaw Point.

key_characters.name: Nimble Dick Crabb
key_characters.description: A local man with knowledge of the area and potential smuggling routes.
key_characters.experience: Crabb provides information about a smugglers' cove and agrees to guide Brienne to the Whispers in exchange for payment.

conversation.scenario: In a dimly lit tavern in Crackclaw Point, Brienne of Tarth encounters Nimble Dick Crabb. The air is thick with tension and the smell of stale ale. Brienne, a tall, muscular woman in armor, stands out among the local patrons. She's been searching tirelessly for Sansa Stark, following every lead, no matter how slim. Crabb, a wiry local known for his cunning, sits at a barrel, nursing a cup of wine. He's caught wind of Brienne's quest and sees an opportunity for profit. The tavern bustles with activity, providing cover for their clandestine conversation.
conversation.topic: Negotiating for information and guidance to the Whispers

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.motivation: I'm so close to a lead on Sansa, I can feel it. This man knows something, but I must tread carefully. Every coin spent, every word exchanged could bring me closer to fulfilling my oath to Lady Catelyn. I'm wary of deception, but desperate for information. I'll pay what I must, but I need to ensure the intelligence is genuine.

key_characters.name: Nimble Dick Crabb
key_characters.motivation: This warrior woman is a golden opportunity. She's clearly desperate for information, and her coin purse seems heavy. I'll need to play this carefully - give her just enough to keep her interested, but not so much that she won't need me anymore. If I play my cards right, I could turn this into a very profitable venture indeed.

dialogues.message: [I need to approach this carefully to get the information I need.] I heard you fooled a fool.
[This could be profitable if I play it right.] (sips his wine, thinking) Mighten be I did. Or not. (eyes Brienne warily) Who is it wants t' know?
[I'll need to use coin to loosen his tongue.] (puts a silver stag on the barrel) King Robert.
[She's willing to pay. I can work with this.] (spins the coin, smiling) I like to see a king dance, hey-nonny hey-nonny hey-nonny-ho. Mighten be I saw this fool of yours.
[Could this be a lead to Sansa?] Was there a girl with him?
[More information means more coin.] Two girls.
[Two girls? Could one be Arya?] (eyes widening) Two girls? Where were they headed?
[I'll give her just enough to keep her interested.] T'other side o' the sea, as I recall.
[I need more details to go on.] Do you remember what he looked like?
[Keep it vague, keep her paying.] A fool. (snatches the spinning coin) A frightened fool.
