[There must be more to this story.] Frightened why?
[Time to dangle the bait.] (edges closer) That Tarly's got soldiers crawling over the docks, watching every ship. Your fool didn't dare. So I offered him some help.
[This could be the lead I've been searching for.] What sort of help?
[Now to reel her in.] The sort that costs more than one silver stag.
[I must know more, whatever the cost.] (puts another stag on the barrel) Tell me, and you'll have another.

plots.summary: Samwell Tarly, along with Gilly, her baby, Maester Aemon, and Dareon, embarks on a treacherous sea voyage from Eastwatch-by-the-Sea to Braavos. They face storms, seasickness, and internal conflicts. Sam struggles to care for the elderly Maester Aemon and comfort the distraught Gilly, while dealing with his own fears and Dareon's increasing resentment.

key_characters.name: Samwell Tarly
key_characters.description: A brother of the Night's Watch, tasked with escorting Maester Aemon and Gilly to Oldtown.
key_characters.experience: Sam struggles with seasickness and fear while trying to care for his companions during the difficult voyage. He attempts to comfort Gilly and protect Maester Aemon, all while grappling with his own insecurities.

key_characters.name: Gilly
key_characters.description: A wildling woman traveling with her baby, fleeing from beyond the Wall.
key_characters.experience: Gilly is deeply distressed throughout the voyage, constantly crying and struggling to care for her baby. Her behavior causes tension among the travelers.

key_characters.name: Aemon Targaryen
key_characters.description: The elderly, blind maester of the Night's Watch.
key_characters.experience: Aemon endures the difficult journey stoically, offering wisdom to Sam. He reveals to Sam that Gilly is grieving for the child she left behind, not the one she brought with her.

key_characters.name: Dareon
key_characters.description: A brother of the Night's Watch, a singer sent to recruit for the Watch.
key_characters.experience: Dareon becomes increasingly resentful of Gilly and her baby, turning to drink and showing little sympathy for their plight.

conversation.scenario: Aboard the ship Blackbird, sailing from Eastwatch-by-the-Sea to Braavos, the group faces a treacherous journey plagued by storms and seasickness. The cramped, dank quarters below deck are filled with the sounds of creaking wood, churning waves, and Gilly's constant sobs. The air is thick with tension and the acrid smell of vomit. Samwell Tarly, struggling with his own nausea, attempts to care for the elderly, blind Maester Aemon and comfort the distraught Gilly. Meanwhile, Dareon's increasing resentment adds to the strained atmosphere.
conversation.topic: Gilly's grief and the challenges of the sea voyage

key_characters.name: Samwell Tarly
key_characters.motivation: I'm overwhelmed by seasickness and the responsibility of caring for everyone. Gilly's constant crying worries me deeply, and I fear for Maester Aemon's health. I must find a way to comfort Gilly and ensure everyone's safety on this perilous voyage. Perhaps Maester Aemon can offer some wisdom or remedy to ease our troubles.

key_characters.name: Gilly
key_characters.motivation: My heart is shattered, torn between the child I left behind and the one I brought with me. The unfamiliar surroundings of the ship and the constant motion terrify me. I can't stop crying, haunted by the choice I was forced to make. I long for comfort but feel isolated in my grief, unable to express the true source of my pain.

key_characters.name: Aemon Targaryen
key_characters.motivation: Despite my physical discomfort, I must remain a source of wisdom for those around me. Sam's kindness is admirable, but he needs to learn to see beyond the surface. Gilly's pain runs deeper than fear of the journey. I must guide Sam to understand the true nature of her grief and the complexities of the situation we find ourselves in.

dialogues.message: [I must find a way to comfort Gilly. Her constant crying is worrying.] Gilly, please don't cry. We're going to a safe place. A warm place.
[I cannot stop the pain in my heart.] (sobs softly, clutching the baby)
[Her distress is affecting everyone. Maybe Maester Aemon can help.] Isn't there something you can give her? Some herb or potion, so she won't be so afraid?
[Sam's kindness is admirable, but he must learn to see deeper.] It is not fear you hear. That is the sound of grief, and there is no potion for that.
[I don't understand. Why would she be grieving?] She's going to a safe place. A warm place. Why should she be grieving?
[I must help Sam understand the complexities of Gilly's situation.] Sam, you have two good eyes, and yet you do not see. She is a mother grieving for her child.
[Confusion and disbelief wash over me.] He's greensick, that's all. We're all greensick. Once we make port in Braavos...
[Sam needs to face the truth, no matter how difficult.] ...the babe will still be Dalla's son, and not the child of her body.
[The realization hits me like a physical blow.] That couldn't... she wouldn't... of course he's hers. Gilly would never have left the Wall without her son. She loves him.

[I must help Sam understand the painful choice Gilly was forced to make.] She nursed them both and loved them both, but not alike. No mother loves all her children the same, not even the Mother Above.
[I feel a mix of shock and betrayal.] No. No, that's wrong. Jon would never...
[Sam must learn the hard truths of leadership.] Jon would never. Lord Snow did. Sometimes there is no happy choice, Sam, only one less grievous than the others.

plots.summary: Queen Cersei receives three men who have brought her a dwarf's head, believing it to be Tyrion's. She dismisses them when she realizes it's not her brother. Cersei then discusses the ongoing search for Tyrion with Qyburn, who has replaced Varys as her spymaster. They also talk about the preparations of Gregor Clegane's skull to be sent to Dorne. Cersei heads to a small council meeting, reflecting on her childhood prophecy and the current political situation.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: The Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, sister to Jaime and Tyrion Lannister.
key_characters.experience: Cersei is obsessed with finding and killing her brother Tyrion. She's paranoid and power-hungry, relying on Qyburn for information and support. She's haunted by a childhood prophecy and is preparing to assert her dominance in the small council.

key_characters.name: Qyburn
key_characters.description: A disgraced former maester, now serving as Cersei's advisor and spymaster.
key_characters.experience: Qyburn has taken Varys' place as the master of whispers. He's loyal to Cersei, providing her with information and carrying out her tasks, including the preparation of Gregor Clegane's skull.

conversation.scenario: In the Queen's audience chamber, a tense atmosphere hangs in the air as Cersei Lannister prepares to receive three men claiming to have Tyrion's head. The room is opulent yet oppressive, reflecting Cersei's power and paranoia. Recent political turmoil has left the kingdom on edge, with Cersei desperately clinging to her position as Queen Regent. The search for her brother Tyrion, accused of regicide, has consumed her. Qyburn, her trusted advisor, stands nearby, ready to offer support. The air is thick with anticipation and the faint scent of decay as the men enter, carrying their grim trophy.
conversation.topic: Examining the alleged head of Tyrion Lannister

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: My heart races with anticipation and dread. Could this truly be Tyrion's head? I must remain composed, regardless of the outcome. This could be the key to securing my power and fulfilling the prophecy that haunts me. I need to assess the situation carefully, balancing my eagerness for vengeance with the need for caution and control.

key_characters.name: Qyburn
key_characters.motivation: I observe the Queen's subtle reactions, ready to provide whatever support she requires. This moment could significantly impact her stability and our plans. I must remain vigilant, analyzing both the alleged evidence and Cersei's response to it. My role is crucial in maintaining her trust and furthering our shared objectives.

dialogues.message: The smell of decay fills the audience chamber as the chief fool pulls a rotting head from the sack.
[I must remain composed, despite the stench and grotesque sight.] (examining the head closely) You've killed the wrong dwarf.
[Confusion and fear wash over me.] We never did. This is got to be him, ser. A dwarf, see. He's rotted some, is all.
[I feel a mix of disappointment and irritation.] He has also grown a new nose. A rather bulbous one, I'd say. Tyrion's nose was hacked off in a battle.
[Panic sets in as I realize our mistake.] No one told us. This one come walking along as bold as you please, some ugly dwarf, so we thought...
[I try to justify our actions.] He said he were a sparrow, and you said he was lying.
[Anger rises within me, but I must control it.] You have wasted my time and slain an innocent man. I should have your own heads off.
[I realize I must not discourage future attempts.] Remove yourselves from my sight.
[Relief floods through me.] Aye, Your Grace. We beg your pardons.
[Unsure what to do with our 'prize'.] Do you want the head?
[Disgust and annoyance fill me.] Give it to Ser Meryn. No, in the sack, you lackwit. Yes. Ser Osmund, see them out.

plots.summary: Cersei attends a small council meeting where she asserts her authority and makes decisions on various matters including the Vale, the Iron Bank, and the Night's Watch. She then manipulates Ser Osney Kettleblack into a plot against Margaery Tyrell, promising him rewards for seducing the young queen and killing Jon Snow. Finally, she instructs Lady Merryweather to spread rumors about Margaery.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: The Queen Regent, manipulative and power-hungry.
key_characters.experience: Cersei dominates the small council meeting, makes crucial decisions, and schemes against Margaery Tyrell by manipulating Ser Osney Kettleblack and Lady Merryweather.

key_characters.name: Osney Kettleblack
key_characters.description: A knight in service to Cersei, easily manipulated.
key_characters.experience: Osney is manipulated by Cersei into agreeing to seduce Margaery Tyrell and kill Jon Snow in exchange for rewards and a lordship.

key_characters.name: Taena Merryweather
key_characters.description: A Myrish noblewoman and Cersei's confidante.
key_characters.experience: Taena is instructed by Cersei to spread rumors about Margaery Tyrell and is used as a tool in Cersei's schemes.

conversation.scenario: In the Red Keep's opulent private chambers, Queen Regent Cersei Lannister prepares to manipulate Ser Osney Kettleblack. The room is dimly lit, creating an intimate atmosphere. The recent small council meeting has left Cersei feeling powerful yet threatened by Margaery Tyrell's influence. Cersei sees an opportunity to eliminate her rival and consolidate power through Ser Osney, a man known for his malleable nature and ambition. The air is thick with tension and unspoken desires as Cersei carefully orchestrates her approach, aware of the delicate balance required to set her plans in motion without arousing suspicion.
conversation.topic: Seducing Margaery Tyrell and killing Jon Snow

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must exploit Osney's weaknesses to secure his loyalty and set my plan against Margaery in motion. The promise of power and pleasure should be enough to sway this simple-minded knight. I'll carefully guide him towards seducing Margaery and eliminating Jon Snow, ensuring my position remains unchallenged. This conversation requires utmost finesse to manipulate without revealing my true intentions.

key_characters.name: Osney Kettleblack
key_characters.motivation: The queen's private summons both excites and unnerves me. Her attention is flattering, but I sense danger lurking beneath her words. I'm eager for advancement and rewards, yet wary of the risks involved in her schemes. I must tread carefully, balancing my ambition with self-preservation, as I navigate whatever task she has in mind for me.

dialogues.message: [I must approach this delicately to ensure his cooperation.] Ser Osney, your loyal service has not gone unnoticed. I have a task that requires a man of your... particular talents.
[I'm intrigued but cautious.] I'm honored, Your Grace. What kind of task did you have in mind?
[I'll appeal to his base desires first.] Tell me true, Ser Osney. Do you think our little queen is pretty?
[I sense a trap but can't help being honest.] I suppose. For a girl. I'd sooner have a woman.
[Perfect, he's taking the bait.] Why not both? (leaning in closer) Pluck the little rose for me, and you will not find me to be ungrateful.
[Alarm bells are ringing in my head.] The little... Margaery, you mean? She's the king's wife. Wasn't there some Kingsguard who lost his head for bedding the king's wife?
[I must reassure him while maintaining the pressure.] Ages ago. Tommen is not Aegon the Unworthy. Have no fear, he will do as I bid him. I mean for Margaery to lose her head, not you.
[I'm both confused and aroused.] Her maidenhead, you mean?
[He's still hesitant. I need to sweeten the deal.] That too. Assuming she still has one. (tracing his scars) Unless you think Margaery would prove unresponsive to your... charms?
[My ego is flattered, but I'm still uncertain.] She likes me well enough. But what happens after we... do the deed?
[Now to introduce the second part of my plan.] Tommen would have no choice but to send you to the Wall. But you will return. All you need to do is kill a boy.
[I'm in too deep to back out now.] What boy?
[I have him now.] A bastard boy in league with Stannis. He's young and green, and you'll have a hundred men. Once this boy is dead, you'd get your pardon from the king.
[The prospect of reward outweighs my fear.] And then what?
[Time to seal the deal.] A queen must have a consort. One who knows no fear. Lord Kettleblack has a nice ring to it, don't you think?
[My ambition gets the better of me.] I am your man, Your Grace.

plots.summary: Victarion Greyjoy sails to Old Wyk for the kingsmoot, where he intends to claim the Seastone Chair. He encounters his niece Asha, who proposes they rule together, and his brother Euron, who has returned from exile. Tensions rise as the three contenders for the throne interact, with Victarion struggling with his past and his ambitions.

key_characters.name: Victarion Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Lord Captain of the Iron Fleet, brother to Balon and Euron Greyjoy.
key_characters.experience: Victarion arrives at Old Wyk intending to claim the throne. He grapples with his past, his loyalty to tradition, and his ambition to become king.

key_characters.name: Asha Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Daughter of Balon Greyjoy, niece to Victarion and Euron.
key_characters.experience: Asha proposes a shared rule with Victarion, demonstrating her political acumen and ambition. She warns him about the challenges they face and Euron's popularity.

key_characters.name: Euron Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Known as the Crow's Eye, recently returned from exile.
key_characters.experience: Euron makes a dramatic entrance, claiming the title of king and showcasing his charisma and ruthlessness. His return causes tension among the Ironborn.

conversation.scenario: On the windswept beach of Old Wyk, Victarion Greyjoy prepares for the imminent kingsmoot. The air is thick with tension as longships crowd the shore, their crews setting up camp amidst ancient ruins. Victarion, a seasoned warrior and Lord Captain of the Iron Fleet, stands resolute, his ambition to claim the Seastone Chair burning within him. He's approached by his niece Asha, a bold and cunning woman who has made her own name as a reaver. The Iron Islands are at a crossroads, with the death of Balon Greyjoy leaving a power vacuum. The return of Euron "Crow's Eye" Greyjoy from exile has added a volatile element to the succession, his reputation for cruelty and adventure preceding him.
conversation.topic: The future leadership of the Iron Islands

key_characters.name: Victarion Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: I must secure my claim to the Seastone Chair. The Iron Islands need a strong, traditional leader, not Euron's madness or a woman's rule. My past haunts me - Euron's betrayal, my wife's infidelity, the kinslaying I was forced to commit. I'll prove my worth through strength and honor, as befits an ironborn. Asha's approach concerns me; what game is she playing?

key_characters.name: Asha Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: Victarion is my best chance to prevent Euron's rule, but he's stubborn and set in the old ways. I must convince him that times are changing and that we need a new approach to secure our future. My proposal for shared rule is risky, but necessary. I'll appeal to his pride, his sense of duty, and if needed, remind him of Euron's treachery. The Iron Islands' fate hangs in the balance.

dialogues.message: [I must approach this carefully. Victarion is stubborn, but I need his support.] Nuncle, hear me. I will place the driftwood crown upon your brow myself . . . if you will agree to share the rule.
[Share the rule? With a woman? This is unexpected and confusing.] Share the rule? How could that be?

[He's not outright rejecting the idea. There's hope.] Then let my nuncle sit. I will stand behind you, to guard your back and whisper in your ear. No king can rule alone. Even when the dragons sat the Iron Throne, they had men to help them. The King's Hands. Let me be your Hand, Nuncle.
[A woman as Hand? It's unheard of. But she is Balon's daughter...] Why would you wish to be my Hand?

[I need to appeal to his practical side.] To end this war before this war ends us. We have won all that we are like to win . . . and stand to lose all just as quick, unless we make a peace. I have shown Lady Glover every courtesy, and she swears her lord will treat with me. If we hand back Deepwood Motte, Torrhen's Square, and Moat Cailin, she says, the northmen will cede us Sea Dragon Point and all the Stony Shore.

[She's being too soft. We are ironborn!] (chuckles) This Lady Glover plays you for a fool, niece. Sea Dragon Point and the Stony Shore are ours. Why hand back anything? Winterfell is burnt and broken, and the Young Wolf rots headless in the earth. We will have all the north, as your lord father dreamed.

[He's not seeing the bigger picture. I must make him understand.] When longships learn to row through trees, perhaps. A fisherman may hook a grey leviathan, but it will drag him down to death unless he cuts it loose. The north is too large for us to hold, and too full of northmen.

[She speaks like a greenlander, not an ironborn. I must put an end to this.] Go back to your dolls, niece. Leave the winning of wars to warriors. (shows his fists) I have two hands. No man needs three.
[He's not listening. I need to change tactics.] I know a man who needs House Harlaw, though.
[She thinks she has me cornered, but I have my own plans.] Hotho Humpback has offered me his daughter for my queen. If I take her, I will have the Harlaws.
[This is unexpected. I need to reassess.] (taken aback) Lord Rodrik rules House Harlaw.

[I have the upper hand now. I must press my advantage.] Rodrik has no daughters, only books. Hotho will be his heir, and I will be the king. (with growing confidence) The Crow's Eye has been too long away.

[He's not seeing the threat Euron poses. I must warn him.] Some men look larger at a distance. Walk amongst the cookfires if you dare, and listen. They are not telling tales of your strength, nor of my famous beauty. They talk only of the Crow's Eye; the far places he has seen, the women he has raped and the men he's killed, the cities he has sacked, the way he burnt Lord Tywin's fleet at Lannisport...
[How dare she give credit to Euron for my deeds!] (insists angrily) I burnt the lion's fleet. With mine own hands I flung the first torch onto his flagship.
[I've struck a nerve. I must press on.] (puts her hand on his arm) The Crow's Eye hatched the scheme. And killed your wife as well... did he not?

[The painful memories resurface. I must control my anger.] (looks at his fists) He put a baby in her belly and made me do the killing. I would have killed him too, but Balon would have no kinslaying in his hall. He sent Euron into exile, never to return...
[I can see the pain in his eyes. Perhaps there's still a chance to sway him.] ...so long as Balon lived?
[The shame and anger are overwhelming. I cannot speak of it further.] (looks at his fists) She gave me horns. I had no choice.
[He's in pain, but I must press my advantage.] I am sorry for you, and sorrier for her... but you leave me small choice but to claim the Seastone Chair myself.
[She cannot be serious. A woman on the Seastone Chair?] You cannot. (dismissively) Your breath is yours to waste, woman.
[He's made his choice. There's nothing more I can do here.] It is. (leaves)

plots.summary: Princess Arianne Martell embarks on a secret mission to crown Myrcella Baratheon as Queen of the Seven Kingdoms, challenging her brother Quentyn's claim to Dorne. With a small group of loyal companions, including Ser Arys Oakheart of the Kingsguard, they travel through the Dornish desert to reach the Greenblood river, where they plan to continue their journey by boat. Along the way, they discuss Dornish history and the current political situation, including the death of Tywin Lannister.

key_characters.name: Arianne Martell
key_characters.description: Princess of Dorne, daughter of Prince Doran Martell, ambitious and cunning.
key_characters.experience: Leads the plot to crown Myrcella as Queen, challenging her brother's claim to Dorne. She manipulates her companions and plans to raise Dorne in rebellion against the Iron Throne.

key_characters.name: Myrcella Baratheon
key_characters.description: Young princess, daughter of Cersei Lannister, betrothed to Trystane Martell.
key_characters.experience: Unwitting pawn in Arianne's plot, confused about her sudden elevation to Queen but trusting of her captors.

key_characters.name: Arys Oakheart
key_characters.description: Kingsguard knight sworn to protect Myrcella, involved in a romantic relationship with Arianne.
key_characters.experience: Torn between his duty to protect Myrcella and his love for Arianne, he helps with the plot while providing information about events in King's Landing.

key_characters.name: Gerold Dayne
key_characters.description: Known as Darkstar, a knight from Starfall, dangerous and unpredictable.
key_characters.experience: Joins Arianne's plot, but shows signs of having his own agenda and a cruel streak that worries Arianne.

conversation.scenario: The ruins of Shandystone stand silent in the Dornish desert as twilight approaches. Princess Arianne Martell and her small band of conspirators have gathered here, awaiting the arrival of Ser Arys Oakheart with Princess Myrcella Baratheon. The air is thick with tension and secrecy as they prepare to set their audacious plan in motion. The recent death of Tywin Lannister has created a power vacuum in King's Landing, presenting an unexpected opportunity for Arianne's scheme to crown Myrcella as Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. The group must navigate treacherous political waters while keeping their true intentions hidden from the young princess.
conversation.topic: The plot to crown Myrcella and recent events in King's Landing

key_characters.name: Arianne Martell
key_characters.motivation: I must remain calm and in control. This is my chance to secure my claim on Dorne and change the fate of the Seven Kingdoms. Myrcella is the key, and I need to manipulate everyone carefully. Ser Arys's love for me is a powerful tool, but Darkstar's unpredictability worries me. I must learn more about the situation in King's Landing to adjust our plans accordingly.

key_characters.name: Gerold Dayne
key_characters.motivation: This plan is reckless and likely to fail, but it may serve my purposes. I'll play along for now, but I'm ready to seize any opportunity that arises. Arianne is naive if she thinks this will bring justice. Perhaps I can push events in a more interesting direction. The girl's presence opens up possibilities that Arianne hasn't considered.

key_characters.name: Arys Oakheart
key_characters.motivation: I'm torn between my duty and my heart. Bringing Myrcella here feels like a betrayal of my vows, but I can't resist Arianne. I must find a way to protect Myrcella while supporting this plot. The news of Tywin's death will change everything. I fear the consequences of our actions, but it's too late to turn back now.

key_characters.name: Myrcella Baratheon
key_characters.motivation: I'm frightened and confused by all this talk of thrones and queens. I trust Princess Arianne and Ser Arys, but something doesn't feel right. Why have we left the Water Gardens in such secrecy? I miss Trystane and worry about Tommen. I hope someone will explain what's really happening soon.

dialogues.message: [I must take control of the situation and set the stage for our journey.] Welcome, Your Grace. These are my true and loyal friends, and they would be yours as well.
[I'm confused and a little scared, but I trust Princess Arianne.] Princess Arianne? (hugs Arianne) Why do they call me queen? Did something bad happen to Tommen?
[I must be careful with my words, not to frighten her too much.] He fell in with evil men, Your Grace, and I fear they have conspired with him to steal your throne.
[Throne? What does she mean?] My throne? You mean, the Iron Throne? He never stole that, Tommen is...
[Perfect, she's questioning it herself.] ...younger than you, surely?
[I remember my lessons about succession.] I am older by a year.
[Now to plant the seed.] That means the Iron Throne by rights is yours. Your brother is only a little boy, you must not blame him. He has bad counselors... but you have friends.
[I must speak with Arianne alone. This is madness, but I cannot stop now.] Princess, I beg a moment's word.
[What news does he bring?] Come. (leads Ser Arys away from the others) How much does the child know?

[I must report everything, though it pains me to betray my vows.] Little enough. Before we left King's Landing, her uncle reminded her that I was her protector and that any commands that I might give her were meant to keep her safe. She has heard them in the streets as well, shouting out for vengeance. She knew this was no game.
[Good, she trusts him. Now for the important news.] Is there anything else I should know?
[This will change everything.] Tywin Lannister is dead. Murdered by the Imp. The queen has assumed the regency.

[This is perfect for our plans!] Has she? A woman on the Iron Throne? (smiles) This is all to the good. If the lords of the Seven Kingdoms grow accustomed to Queen Cersei's rule, it will be that much easier for them to bend their knees to Queen Myrcella.
[Their plan is foolish. There are quicker ways to start a war.] This plan of yours may not yield you what you want, princess.
[He's dangerous, but we need him.] And what is it I want, ser?
[She's playing coy, but I see through her.] The Sand Snakes freed. Vengeance for Oberyn and Elia. Do I know the song? You want a little taste of lion blood.
[He's not wrong, but there's more to it.] I want justice.

[Justice? How naive.] Call it what you will. Crowning the Lannister girl is a hollow gesture. She will never sit the Iron Throne. Nor will you get the war you want. The lion is not so easily provoked.
[He underestimates me.] The lion's dead. Who knows which cub the lioness prefers?
The sun begins to set, casting long shadows across the ruins of Shandystone. The air grows cooler as night approaches, and the sounds of the desert become more pronounced.

plots.summary: Arianne Martell's plot to crown Myrcella Baratheon as Queen is thwarted by Areo Hotah. Ser Arys Oakheart dies defending Arianne, and she is captured. The chapter ends with Arianne being taken back to Sunspear, devastated by the failure of her plan and the death of Ser Arys.

key_characters.name: Arianne Martell
key_characters.description: Princess of Dorne, daughter of Prince Doran Martell, ambitious and cunning.
key_characters.experience: Leads the plot to crown Myrcella, which fails. She is captured and brought back to Sunspear, devastated by the outcome and questioning how her father knew of her plans.

key_characters.name: Arys Oakheart
key_characters.description: Kingsguard knight sworn to protect Myrcella, involved in a romantic relationship with Arianne.
key_characters.experience: Dies defending Arianne and Myrcella from Areo Hotah's men, charging into battle despite being outnumbered.

key_characters.name: Areo Hotah
key_characters.description: Captain of Prince Doran's guard, loyal and dutiful.
key_characters.experience: Intercepts Arianne's group, kills Ser Arys Oakheart, and captures Arianne on Prince Doran's orders.

key_characters.name: Myrcella Baratheon
key_characters.description: Young princess, daughter of Cersei Lannister, betrothed to Trystane Martell.
key_characters.experience: Caught in the middle of Arianne's failed plot, possibly injured during the confrontation.

conversation.scenario: On the banks of the Greenblood river in Dorne, Arianne Martell's secret plot to crown Myrcella Baratheon as Queen of the Seven Kingdoms has been intercepted. Areo Hotah, captain of Prince Doran's guard, along with his men, have surrounded Arianne's group. The air is tense with the impending confrontation. The lush riverbank contrasts sharply with the dangerous standoff. Ser Arys Oakheart, a Kingsguard knight, stands protectively near Arianne and Myrcella. The young princess Myrcella looks frightened and confused, caught in the middle of this unexpected turn of events. The sound of the flowing river mixes with the nervous shuffling of horses and the creak of tightening crossbows.
conversation.topic: The confrontation and aftermath of Arianne's failed plot

key_characters.name: Arianne Martell
key_characters.motivation: Panic and disbelief course through me. My carefully laid plans are crumbling before my eyes. How did my father discover our plot? I must find a way to salvage this situation, to protect Myrcella and myself. Perhaps I can still negotiate or find an escape route. I need to stay calm and think quickly.

key_characters.name: Arys Oakheart
key_characters.motivation: My heart races with fear and determination. I've broken my vows for Arianne, but I will not fail in my duty to protect Myrcella. I love Arianne, but my honor as a Kingsguard comes first now. If this is to be my last stand, let it be a glorious one. I must buy them time to escape, even at the cost of my life.

key_characters.name: Areo Hotah
key_characters.motivation: I feel the weight of my duty heavily upon me. Prince Doran's orders are clear, but I take no pleasure in this task. I must end this rebellion swiftly and with minimal bloodshed if possible. The princess must be captured alive, but I will not hesitate to use force if necessary. I hope she surrenders peacefully.

key_characters.name: Myrcella Baratheon
key_characters.motivation: Fear grips my heart as I struggle to understand what's happening. One moment we were on an adventure, and now we're surrounded by armed men. I trust Arianne and Ser Arys, but I'm terrified. Why are they talking about crowning me? I want to go back to the Water Gardens where it's safe.

dialogues.message: [I must act swiftly to end this rebellion.] Yield, my princess, else we must slay all but the child and yourself, by your father's word.
[I can't believe this is happening. I must try to escape.] Away! (turns to Ser Arys) Arys, protect the princess—
[I must fulfill my duty, even if it costs my life.] You will not take her whilst I still draw breath. (puts his horse between Arianne and the crossbows)
[He's going to get himself killed!] (thinks) You reckless fool, what do you think you're doing?
[This is madness. They're all fools.] Are you blind or stupid, Oakheart? There are too many. Put up your sword.
[I choose death with honor over life with shame.] (gives Arianne one last longing look, then charges towards the poleboat)
The air fills with the sound of crossbow bolts being released and the thundering of hooves as Ser Arys charges. The scene becomes chaotic with shouts, screams, and the clash of weapons.
[Horror and disbelief overwhelm me as I watch Arys charge to his death.] Noooo! (shrieks) No, please, this was not supposed to happen.
[I must end this quickly.] (swings his longaxe, decapitating Ser Arys) After him. He must not escape. After him!
[I feel numb with shock and grief.] (falls to her knees, sobbing) How could he know? I was so careful. How could he know?
[I feel pity for the princess, but I must follow my orders.] The prince said I must bring you back to Sunspear. I am sorry, little princess.
[Confusion and despair overwhelm me.] Someone told. (looks up at Hotah) Someone always tells.

plots.summary: Arya continues her training at the House of Black and White in Braavos. She struggles with letting go of her identity and learns about the origins of the Faceless Men. She hides Needle instead of discarding it, showing her reluctance to fully let go of her past. Arya begins learning Braavosi and the art of detecting lies.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.description: Young girl training to become a Faceless Man, struggling with her identity.
key_characters.experience: Continues her training, learns about the Faceless Men's history, hides Needle instead of discarding it, and begins learning Braavosi and lie detection.

key_characters.name: The Kindly Man
key_characters.description: Mentor figure at the House of Black and White, guides Arya in her training.
key_characters.experience: Teaches Arya about the Faceless Men's origins, instructs her to give up her possessions, and begins training her in lie detection.

key_characters.name: The Waif
key_characters.description: Young acolyte at the House of Black and White, assists in Arya's training.
key_characters.experience: Helps teach Arya Braavosi and engages in the lying game with her to improve Arya's skills in detecting falsehoods.

conversation.scenario: In the austere House of Black and White in Braavos, Arya Stark faces a crucial moment in her training to become a Faceless Man. The stone halls echo with distant prayers as she stands before the Kindly Man, her mentor. He has instructed her to give up all her possessions, a test of her commitment to becoming No One. The air is thick with the scent of candles and unspoken tension. Arya's past and identity hang in the balance as she grapples with the weight of this decision, her cherished sword Needle hidden away, a secret rebellion against fully letting go of her former self.
conversation.topic: Arya's identity and her attachment to her past

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.motivation: I'm torn between my desire to learn the secrets of the Faceless Men and my reluctance to let go of my identity. Needle is hidden, but can I truly become No One? I want to prove my strength and determination, yet I fear losing myself entirely. I must convince the Kindly Man of my commitment while preserving my core self.

key_characters.name: The Kindly Man
key_characters.motivation: Arya Stark clings too tightly to her past. She must understand that becoming a Faceless Man requires complete surrender of self. I must push her to confront this truth, to test her resolve and readiness for our ways. Will she truly give up everything, or is she not yet prepared for the path she claims to seek?

dialogues.message: [She must learn to let go of her attachments.] You need to rid yourself of all this. These things belong to Arya of House Stark. There is no place for them here.
[I feel a sense of panic at the thought of losing my possessions.] They're mine.
[She still clings to her identity.] And who are you?
[I must give the answer he expects.] No one.

[She lies, but not convincingly.] A lie. Before you drink from the cold cup, you must offer up all you are to Him of Many Faces. Your body. Your soul. Yourself. If you cannot bring yourself to do that, you must leave this place.
[I can't leave, but I don't want to give up everything.] I don't have any gold.
[She misunderstands the true cost.] What we offer cannot be bought with gold. The cost is all of you.
[I must convince him I'm strong enough.] I'm strong. As strong as you. I'm hard.

[She is determined, but still attached to her past.] Stay, and the Many-Faced God will take your ears, your nose, your tongue. He will take your sad grey eyes that have seen so much. He will take your hands, your feet, your arms and legs, your private parts. He will take your hopes and dreams, your loves and hates. Those who enter His service must give up all that makes them who they are. Can you do that?
[I feel defiant, but also scared.] I could if I wanted to.
[She is not ready, but I will give her one more chance.] So says Arya of House Stark, eater of grave worms.
[I will prove him wrong.] I can give up anything I want!
The stone walls of the House of Black and White loom around them, cold and unforgiving. The air is heavy with the scent of candles and the faint whisper of prayers from distant chambers.

plots.summary: Sansa Stark, disguised as Alayne Stone, prepares for the arrival of the Lords Declarant at the Eyrie. She helps organize the meeting, chooses appropriate attire to maintain her disguise, and greets the lords. The chapter ends with tension as the lords make suggestive comments about her.

key_characters.name: Sansa Stark
key_characters.description: Disguised as Alayne Stone, Littlefinger's bastard daughter.
key_characters.experience: Prepares for the Lords Declarant's arrival, maintains her disguise, and navigates the tense political situation at the Eyrie.

key_characters.name: Petyr Baelish
key_characters.description: Lord Protector of the Vale, posing as Alayne's father.
key_characters.experience: Instructs Alayne on how to handle the Lords Declarant's visit and discusses political strategy with her.

key_characters.name: Robert Arryn
key_characters.description: Young Lord of the Eyrie, sickly and prone to fits.
key_characters.experience: Has a tantrum during breakfast, highlighting the precarious situation in the Vale.

conversation.scenario: The Eyrie, a formidable castle perched atop the Mountains of the Moon, braces for a pivotal meeting. Sansa Stark, disguised as Alayne Stone, awaits the arrival of the Lords Declarant in the High Hall. The castle's tense atmosphere reflects the precarious political situation in the Vale following Lysa Arryn's death. Alayne, coached by Petyr Baelish, has meticulously prepared for this encounter, choosing attire that reinforces her false identity. The young Robert Arryn's earlier tantrum lingers in everyone's minds, emphasizing the instability of the current leadership. As the lords enter, Alayne steels herself for a delicate balancing act of hospitality and secrecy.
conversation.topic: The arrival of the Lords Declarant and Alayne's true identity

key_characters.name: Sansa Stark
key_characters.motivation: My heart races beneath my carefully chosen dress. I must embody Alayne Stone completely, suppressing any hint of Sansa Stark. Lord Royce's presence terrifies me; his recognition could shatter everything. I need to be the perfect hostess, diplomatic yet unremarkable. Father's lessons echo in my mind: observe, learn, and above all, keep our secrets. The weight of the Vale's future rests on this meeting's outcome.

key_characters.name: Yohn Royce
key_characters.motivation: This girl... there's something hauntingly familiar about her. Her features, her bearing - they remind me of someone, but I can't quite place it. Could Littlefinger be hiding more than just his ambitions? I must remain vigilant and observe closely. The future of the Vale depends on unraveling the mysteries surrounding Baelish and his supposed daughter. Every interaction could provide a clue.

dialogues.message: [I'm nervous but must appear confident.] Lord Royce, will you have a cup of wine, to take the chill off?
[This girl reminds me of someone.] Do I know you, girl?
[My heart is racing. I must not give myself away.] (She remains silent, feeling as though she had swallowed her tongue)
[I should clarify the situation.] Alayne is the Lord Protector's natural daughter.
[An opportunity for a crude jest.] Littlefinger's little finger has been busy.
Lord Belmore laughs at Ser Lyn's comment, adding to the tension in the room. Alayne's cheeks flush with embarrassment.
[I should assess this girl's age.] How old are you, child?
[I must remember Alayne's age, not my own.] Four-fourteen, my lady. And I am no child, but a maiden flowered.
[An opportunity for innuendo.] But not deflowered, one can hope.
[I'll add to the discomfort.] Yet.
[I feel uncomfortable and vulnerable, but I must maintain my composure.] (She remains silent, unsure how to respond to the suggestive comments)
The tension in the room increases as the lords make suggestive comments about Alayne. The atmosphere becomes charged with unspoken intentions and political maneuvering.

plots.summary: Queen Cersei deals with various matters of state, including her young son King Tommen's desire to sit on the Iron Throne, negotiations with the Iron Bank, and concerns about the influence of Margaery Tyrell. She also observes Tommen practicing jousting under Ser Loras's guidance, which displeases her. Cersei seeks to limit Margaery's influence and considers appointing a new master-at-arms for Tommen.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, mother of King Tommen.
key_characters.experience: Cersei navigates political challenges and attempts to maintain control over her son and the realm. She is wary of Margaery Tyrell's influence and seeks to counter it.

key_characters.name: Tommen Baratheon
key_characters.description: Young king of the Seven Kingdoms, son of Cersei.
key_characters.experience: Tommen desires to sit on the Iron Throne and begins jousting lessons, showing enthusiasm for knightly pursuits.

key_characters.name: Margaery Tyrell
key_characters.description: Queen consort, wife of King Tommen.
key_characters.experience: Margaery is seen as a threat by Cersei due to her growing influence over Tommen and her popularity at court.

conversation.scenario: In the Red Keep, Queen Regent Cersei Lannister meets with her young son King Tommen in her private chambers. The realm faces political challenges and economic pressures. Cersei grapples with maintaining control over both Tommen and the kingdom, while wary of Margaery Tyrell's growing influence. Tommen, eager to assert himself as king, has recently begun jousting lessons under Ser Loras's tutelage, much to Cersei's displeasure. The air is tense with unspoken power struggles and Cersei's attempts to shield Tommen from court intrigues.
conversation.topic: Tommen's request to sit on the Iron Throne

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must delicately balance Tommen's royal education while protecting him from Margaery's manipulations. He's too young to truly rule, but I can't alienate him. I need to redirect his attention and maintain my authority without seeming overbearing. Perhaps I can use this conversation to gauge Margaery's influence and find ways to counter it.

key_characters.name: Tommen Baratheon
key_characters.motivation: I'm frustrated with being treated like a child when I'm the king. Margaery encourages me to take charge, but Mother always resists. I want to prove I can handle royal duties like sitting on the Iron Throne. I'm nervous about confronting Mother, but determined to assert myself, even if it means disappointing her.

dialogues.message: [I'm tired of being treated like a child. I am the king, after all.] I want to sit on the Iron Throne. You always let Joff sit up there.
[I must be firm but gentle with him. He's still so young.] Joffrey was twelve.
[She's not understanding how important this is to me.] But I'm the king. The throne belongs to me.
[I can smell Margaery's influence in this. I must nip this in the bud.] Who told you that?
[I don't want to get Margaery in trouble, but I can't lie to Mother.] (His face turns red) No one told me.

[He's lying to protect her. I must press harder.] No one? Is that what you call your lady wife? If you lie to me, I will have no choice but to send for Pate and have him beaten till he bleeds. Is that what you want?
[I don't want Pate to be hurt because of me.] (Mutters sullenly) No.
[I've got him now.] Who told you?
[I'm sorry, Margaery.] (Shuffles his feet) Lady Margaery.

[Just as I suspected. I must put a stop to this.] That is better. Tommen, I have grave matters to decide, matters that you are far too young to understand. I do not need a silly little boy fidgeting on the throne behind me and distracting me with childish questions. I suppose Margaery thinks you ought to be at my council meetings too?
[Margaery was right, I should learn to be king.] Yes. She says I have to learn to be king.

[I must placate him without giving in.] When you are older, you can attend as many councils as you wish. I promise you, you will soon grow sick of them. Robert used to doze through the sessions. He preferred to hunt and hawk, and leave the tedium to old Lord Arryn. Do you remember him?
[I barely remember Lord Arryn, but I know what happened to him.] He died of a bellyache.

[Perfect, I can use this to distract him.] So he did, poor man. As you are so eager to learn, perhaps you should learn the names of all the kings of Westeros and the Hands who served them. You may recite them to me on the morrow.
[I don't really want to do that, but I don't want to disappoint Mother.] Yes, Mother.
[That should keep him occupied and away from Margaery's influence for a while.] That's my good boy.

plots.summary: Brienne, Podrick, and Ser Hyle Hunt return to Maidenpool with the heads of the Bloody Mummers they killed. They meet with Lord Randyll Tarly, who is dismissive of Brienne's quest to find Sansa Stark. Tarly orders Brienne to leave Maidenpool, forcing her and Podrick to seek shelter on ships in the harbor. They struggle to find accommodation but eventually secure a place on a damaged trading galley.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A female warrior on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
key_characters.experience: Brienne persists in her mission despite facing ridicule and obstacles. She refuses to give up her search for Sansa and continues to navigate challenges with determination.

key_characters.name: Podrick Payne
key_characters.description: Brienne's young squire accompanying her on her quest.
key_characters.experience: Podrick remains loyal to Brienne, offering suggestions and support as they search for lodging and continue their journey.

key_characters.name: Randyll Tarly
key_characters.description: Lord of Horn Hill and current ruler of Maidenpool.
key_characters.experience: Tarly is dismissive and cruel towards Brienne, ordering her to leave Maidenpool and expressing his disdain for her quest and her very existence.

conversation.scenario: Brienne of Tarth and her squire Podrick Payne find themselves in Maidenpool, a town under the control of Lord Randyll Tarly. They have just been dismissed by Lord Tarly, who scorned Brienne's quest to find Sansa Stark. Forced to leave the town, they now seek shelter in the harbor, hoping to find accommodation on one of the ships. The sun is setting, casting long shadows across the bustling port. The air is thick with the smell of salt and fish, and the sounds of sailors and merchants fill the air. Brienne and Podrick are weary from their journey and recent confrontations, their clothes dusty and travel-worn.
conversation.topic: Deciding whether to continue the search for Sansa Stark

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.motivation: I'm frustrated by Lord Tarly's dismissal but determined to continue my quest. I must find Lady Sansa to fulfill my oath to Lady Catelyn. The constant ridicule and obstacles weigh heavily on me, but I cannot falter. I'm concerned about finding safe shelter for Podrick and myself tonight, and I'm pondering our next move in the search for Sansa.

key_characters.name: Podrick Payne
key_characters.motivation: I'm loyal to Lady Brienne and want to support her, but I'm increasingly worried about our safety and the difficulties we face. I'm exhausted from our travels and encounters. Part of me wishes we could find an easier path, maybe even return home, but I don't want to disappoint Lady Brienne. I'm hoping we can find comfortable lodging for the night, but I'm prepared for any hardship.

dialogues.message: [I'm concerned about our safety, but I don't want to disappoint Lady Brienne.] Ser? My lady? What if my lady did go home? My other lady, I mean. Ser. Lady Sansa.
[I understand his concern, but I can't abandon my quest.] They burned her home.
[I need to find a way to convince her.] Still. That's where her gods are. And gods can't die.

[His innocence is touching, but the reality is much harsher.] Gods cannot die, but girls can. Timeon was a cruel man and a murderer, but I do not think he lied about the Hound. We cannot go north until we know for certain. There will be other ships.
[I'm worried, but I trust Lady Brienne's judgment.] Yes, my lady. Where shall we go now?
[We need to find a safe place for the night.] We'll try the ships in the harbor. Perhaps we can find a captain willing to let us sleep aboard.
[I hope we find somewhere comfortable.] Do you think they'll have real beds, my lady?
[I must prepare him for disappointment.] Likely not, Pod. We may have to make do with hammocks or the deck itself. But it will be shelter from the elements.
[I'm tired, but I won't complain.] I don't mind, my lady. I can sleep anywhere.
[His resilience impresses me.] That's good, Pod. We may need that skill in the days to come. Come, let's try the east end of the harbor.

plots.summary: Samwell Tarly, Gilly, and Maester Aemon are in Braavos, struggling with poverty and illness. Dareon, their companion, has abandoned them to pursue a life of singing and pleasure. Maester Aemon's health is deteriorating rapidly, and Sam is trying to care for him with limited resources. They plan to travel to Oldtown, but face challenges in finding passage and affording necessities.

key_characters.name: Samwell Tarly
key_characters.description: A brother of the Night's Watch, trying to care for his companions in Braavos.
key_characters.experience: Sam is struggling with the responsibility of caring for Maester Aemon and Gilly while dealing with limited resources and Dareon's abandonment. He feels fear and inadequacy but tries to manage their situation.

key_characters.name: Aemon Targaryen
key_characters.description: An ancient, blind maester of the Night's Watch, now very ill.
key_characters.experience: Aemon is in poor health, often confused and feverish. He is fixated on learning about dragons and reaching Oldtown, despite his weakened state.

key_characters.name: Gilly
key_characters.description: A wildling girl with a baby, traveling with Sam and Aemon.
key_characters.experience: Gilly is grieving and struggling to adapt to life in Braavos. She cares for her baby and tries to help Sam, but is out of her element in the city.

key_characters.name: Dareon
key_characters.description: A brother of the Night's Watch who has abandoned his companions.
key_characters.experience: Dareon has chosen to pursue a life of singing and pleasure in Braavos, neglecting his duty to his brothers and leaving them without resources.

conversation.scenario: In a dimly lit, cold room of a modest Braavosi inn, Samwell Tarly and Maester Aemon are struggling to survive. Their meager funds are dwindling, and they've been abandoned by Dareon, who was supposed to help them. The room is sparsely furnished, with a single bed where Aemon lies, weak and feverish. Outside, the bustling sounds of Braavos can be heard, a stark contrast to their dire situation. Sam has been tirelessly caring for Aemon, Gilly, and her baby, feeling the weight of responsibility on his shoulders. They urgently need to find passage to Oldtown, but face numerous obstacles.
conversation.topic: Maester Aemon's health and their plans to reach Oldtown

key_characters.name: Samwell Tarly
key_characters.motivation: I'm overwhelmed with worry for Maester Aemon's deteriorating health and our precarious situation. We're running out of money and supplies, and I feel utterly alone in this foreign city. I must find a way to get us to Oldtown safely, but how? I'm terrified of failing, yet I know I must stay strong for everyone's sake. I need to convince Aemon to eat and rest, while also planning our next move.

key_characters.name: Aemon Targaryen
key_characters.motivation: My mind is clouded, drifting between past and present. I feel an overwhelming urgency to learn about the dragons before it's too late. We must reach Oldtown quickly, but I'm so weak. I'm struggling to stay focused, often confusing Sam with figures from my past. The cold seeps into my bones, yet the fire of my mission burns within me. I must convey the importance of our quest to Sam, despite my frailty.

dialogues.message: [I feel disoriented and weak, but I must focus on our mission.] Egg? It's dark. Why is it so dark?
[My heart aches seeing him so confused. I must be patient.] It's me, Samwell Tarly. Your steward.
[I struggle to gather my thoughts.] Sam. Yes. And this is Braavos. Forgive me, Sam. Is morning come?
[I'm worried about his fever.] (Feeling Aemon's brow) No. It's night, maester. You've been asleep.
[I feel so cold and weak.] Too long. It's cold in here.
[I feel guilty for not being able to provide better care.] We have no wood, and the innkeep will not give us more unless we have the coin.
[Despite my weakness, I know we must press on.] We must go down to the ships.
[I need to protect him from overexertion.] You're too weak to go out. On the morrow we can go to the docks. You can ask about and find which ship is departing next for Oldtown.

[My mind drifts to memories and urgent questions.] Oldtown. Yes. I dreamt of Oldtown, Sam. I was young again and my brother Egg was with me, with that big knight he served. We were drinking in the old inn where they make the fearsomely strong cider.
[I'm concerned about his lack of appetite.] Are you hungry, maester? We have some bread left, and a bit of cheese.
[I feel no hunger, only urgency.] Not just now, Sam. Later, when I'm feeling stronger. The ships. We will find our answer there. About the dragons. I need to know.
[I must find a way to nourish him.] How will you get stronger unless you eat? Perhaps a sip of wine, though?

plots.summary: Jaime Lannister prepares to leave King's Landing on a mission to Riverrun, ordered by his sister Cersei. Their conversation is tense, revealing strained relations and hints of Cersei's infidelity. Jaime assembles a force of about a thousand men and sets out, accompanied by Ser Ilyn Payne. He reflects on the state of the realm and his own conflicted feelings about his sister and his duty.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: Lord Commander of the Kingsguard, recently returned to King's Landing.
key_characters.experience: Jaime is struggling with his relationship with Cersei, his role as Lord Commander, and his mission to Riverrun. He's conflicted about his duties and haunted by suspicions of Cersei's infidelity.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: Queen Regent, Jaime's twin sister
key_characters.experience: Cersei is manipulative and power-hungry, ordering Jaime to Riverrun despite his protests. Their interaction reveals a strained relationship and hints at her infidelities.

key_characters.name: Ilyn Payne
key_characters.description: The King's Justice, a mute knight
key_characters.experience: Ser Ilyn is chosen by Jaime to accompany him on the mission, serving as a silent companion.

conversation.scenario: In the Red Keep of King's Landing, Jaime Lannister meets with his twin sister Cersei in her chambers. The air is thick with tension and unspoken accusations. Jaime, recently returned and appointed Lord Commander of the Kingsguard, faces a difficult mission to Riverrun. The realm is in turmoil, with threats from various factions. Cersei, now Queen Regent, wields her power assertively. Their once passionate relationship has become strained, marred by suspicion and resentment. As they prepare to discuss Jaime's assignment, both struggle with conflicting emotions and hidden agendas.
conversation.topic: Jaime's assignment to Riverrun and their strained relationship

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I'm torn between duty and desire. Cersei's orders feel wrong, yet I'm bound to obey. I suspect her infidelity but can't shake my feelings for her. My lost hand haunts me, making me question my worth and role. I want to protect Tommen, honor my oath to Catelyn Stark, and understand Cersei's true motives.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must maintain control over Jaime and ensure he follows my plans. His hesitation threatens my authority. I'll use our past intimacy and his insecurities to manipulate him if needed. I'm determined to secure my power, even if it means pushing Jaime away. His loyalty must be to me and my ambitions alone.

dialogues.message: [I need to remind him of his place and my authority.] I had hoped that by now you would have grown tired of that wretched beard. All that hair makes you look like Robert.
[Her comparison irritates me, but I try to keep my tone light.] Robert's beard was black. Mine is gold.

[I'll show him how he's aging, maybe that will make him more compliant.] (Plucks a hair from his chin) Gold? Or silver? All the color is draining out of you, brother. You've become a ghost of what you were, a pale crippled thing.
[Her words sting, but I won't let her see that.] I will make a bargain with you. Relieve me of this duty, and my razor is yours to command.
[His attempt at negotiation angers me.] (Mouth tightening) You presume to dicker with me? Need I remind you, you are sworn to obey.
[I try to reason with her, appealing to my duty.] I am sworn to protect the king. My place is at his side.
[I won't let him defy me.] Your place is wherever he sends you.

[I question her decisions, trying to understand her motives.] Tommen puts his seal on every paper that you put in front of him. This is your doing, and it's folly. Why name Daven your Warden of the West if you have no faith in him?
[I'll question his courage to provoke him into compliance.] Why so reluctant, ser? Did you lose your courage with your hand?
[I remind her of my oath, hoping she'll understand.] I swore an oath to Lady Stark, never again to take up arms against the Starks or Tullys.
[I dismiss his concerns with contempt.] A drunken promise made with a sword at your throat.
[Frustrated, I make one last attempt to reason with her.] How can I defend Tommen if I am not with him?

plots.summary: Jaime Lannister travels to Harrenhal, deals with the aftermath of Gregor Clegane's occupation, and appoints Ser Bonifer Hasty as castellan. He encounters Red Ronnet Connington at the bear pit, where they discuss Brienne of Tarth and the history of House Connington.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: Lord Commander of the Kingsguard, leading a force to Riverrun.
key_characters.experience: Jaime takes charge at Harrenhal, deals with the Mountain's men, and reflects on his past and current situation. He shows a mix of practicality and growing empathy.

key_characters.name: Bonifer Hasty
key_characters.description: A pious knight appointed as castellan of Harrenhal.
key_characters.experience: Ser Bonifer is appointed by Jaime to hold Harrenhal. He is deeply religious and aims to bring order to the castle and surrounding lands.

key_characters.name: Ronnet Connington
key_characters.description: A knight from House Connington, formerly betrothed to Brienne.
key_characters.experience: Ronnet encounters Jaime at the bear pit and reveals his past connection to Brienne, showing disdain for her appearance and character.

conversation.scenario: In the eerie halls of Harrenhal, Jaime Lannister encounters Red Ronnet Connington at the infamous bear pit. The night is dark, with only flickering lantern light illuminating the scene. The castle, recently liberated from Gregor Clegane's brutal occupation, still bears the scars of recent violence. Jaime, having just appointed Ser Bonifer Hasty as castellan, is on his way to Riverrun. The bear pit, a place of recent trauma for Brienne of Tarth, serves as a grim reminder of the cruelty that transpired here. The conversation unfolds against this backdrop of darkness and lingering tension.
conversation.topic: Brienne of Tarth and House Connington's history

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Wary and intrigued by Connington's presence, Jaime feels a mix of curiosity and irritation. He's protective of Brienne's honor, recalling her ordeal in this very pit. Jaime aims to understand Connington's connection to Brienne while maintaining his composure as Lord Commander. He's also keenly aware of the political implications of their families' histories.

key_characters.name: Ronnet Connington
key_characters.motivation: Connington revels in the opportunity to belittle Brienne and assert his perceived superiority. He's eager to share his past connection to her, taking pleasure in mocking her appearance and character. Beneath his bravado, he harbors a desire to impress Jaime Lannister, conscious of their differing social statuses and family legacies.

dialogues.message: [I'm surprised to see him here. What's his purpose?] Ser Ronnet, have you lost your way? It is a large castle, I know.
[I relish the chance to mock Brienne.] (Raising his lantern) I wished to see where the bear danced with the maiden not-so-fair. Is it true the wench fought naked?

[His crudeness annoys me, but I maintain my composure.] Naked? No. The Mummers put her in a pink silk gown and shoved a tourney sword into her hand. The Goat wanted her death to be amuthing. Elsewise...
[I can't resist another jab at Brienne's appearance.] (Laughing) ...the sight of Brienne naked might have made the bear flee in terror.
[His familiarity with Brienne intrigues me.] You speak as if you know the lady.
[I take pride in revealing this information.] I was betrothed to her.
[This is unexpected. Why didn't Brienne mention this?] That took him by surprise. Her father made a match for her...
[I enjoy recounting this story.] Thrice. I was the second. My father's notion. I had heard the wench was ugly, and I told him so, but he said all women were the same once you blew the candle out.
[I'm curious about his family connection to Jon Connington.] Your father. (Eyeing Red Ronnet's surcoat) Our late Hand's... brother, was he?
[I clarify the family relation, somewhat proud of the connection.] Cousin. Lord Jon had no brothers.
[The memories of the past come flooding back.] No. It all came back to him. Jon Connington had been Prince Rhaegar's friend...

plots.summary: Queen Cersei travels to the Great Sept of Baelor to meet with the new High Septon. She encounters a large group of sparrows occupying the plaza. After negotiating with the High Septon, Cersei agrees to forgive the crown's debt to the Faith in exchange for allowing the reestablishment of the Faith Militant and securing Tommen's blessing.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, mother of King Tommen.
key_characters.experience: Cersei navigates political and religious tensions, manipulating the situation to her advantage by negotiating with the High Septon and reestablishing the Faith Militant.

key_characters.name: High Septon
key_characters.description: The newly appointed leader of the Faith of the Seven, known as the High Sparrow.
key_characters.experience: The High Septon, a humble and pious man, negotiates with Cersei to address the suffering of the common people and strengthen the Faith's position in the realm.

key_characters.name: Taena Merryweather
key_characters.description: A companion and confidante to Queen Cersei.
key_characters.experience: Taena accompanies Cersei to the Great Sept and engages in conversation about the political situation and Margaery Tyrell's court.

conversation.scenario: The Great Sept of Baelor stands imposingly in King's Landing, its plaza now crowded with sparrows - poor, pious followers of the Faith. Queen Cersei Lannister arrives with her entourage, her golden hair and crimson gown a stark contrast to the humble masses. The new High Septon, known for his modest ways, awaits inside. Tension hangs in the air as Cersei, struggling to maintain her composure, prepares to negotiate with the religious leader. The realm is still reeling from recent conflicts, and the common people's suffering is evident. This meeting could reshape the balance of power between the Crown and the Faith.
conversation.topic: Negotiation between the Crown and the Faith

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must assert my authority while appearing pious. These sparrows are a nuisance, but I can use this situation to my advantage. I need to secure Tommen's reign and rid the city of these bothersome peasants. The High Septon may be a problem, but perhaps I can manipulate him. I must be careful not to let my irritation show too much.

key_characters.name: High Septon
key_characters.motivation: The suffering of the common people weighs heavily on my conscience. I must use this meeting to strengthen the Faith's position and address the widespread misery in the realm. Queen Cersei is formidable, but perhaps I can appeal to her sense of piety. I need to emphasize forgiveness and the plight of the poor while standing firm on the Faith's principles.

dialogues.message: [I need to assert my authority while appearing pious.] Your Holiness, these sparrows are frightening the city. I want them gone.
[I must emphasize the plight of the common people.] Where should they go, Your Grace?
[I struggle to hide my irritation.] Back where they came from, I would imagine.
[I need to make her understand the widespread suffering.] They came from everywhere. As the sparrow is the humblest and most common of the birds, they are the humblest and most common of men.
[I must redirect the conversation to my concerns.] Have you seen what they have done to Blessed Baelor's statue? They befoul the plaza with their pigs and goats and night soil.
[I see an opportunity to address past injustices.] Night soil can be washed away more easily than blood, Your Grace. If the plaza was befouled, it was befouled by the execution that was done here.

[I cannot let him challenge Joffrey's actions.] We all regret that. Joffrey was young, and not as wise as he might have been. Lord Stark should have been beheaded elsewhere, out of respect for Blessed Baelor... but the man was a traitor, let us not forget.
[I must emphasize the importance of forgiveness.] King Baelor forgave those who conspired against him.
[I need to steer this conversation towards a resolution.] King Tommen will forgive the sparrows too, once they have returned to their homes.

[I must make her understand the extent of the suffering.] Most have lost their homes. Suffering is everywhere... and grief, and death. Before coming to King's Landing, I tended to half a hundred little villages too small to have a septon of their own. I walked from each one to the next, performing marriages, absolving sinners of their sins, naming newborn children. Those villages are no more, Your Grace. Weeds and thorns grow where gardens once flourished, and bones litter the roadsides.
[I see an opportunity to shift blame.] War is a dreadful thing. These atrocities are the work of the northmen, and of Lord Stannis and his demon-worshipers.

plots.summary: Victarion Greyjoy leads the Iron Fleet in a successful attack on the Shield Islands. He captures ships and defeats Ser Talbert Serry in single combat. After the battle, Victarion reflects on his conflicted feelings about his brother Euron's kingship and methods. He returns to Lord Hewett's Town, where the ironborn are celebrating their victory and taking plunder. Victarion discusses the implications of their conquest with other ironborn leaders.

key_characters.name: Victarion Greyjoy
key_characters.description: The iron captain, leader of the Iron Fleet, and brother to King Euron Greyjoy.
key_characters.experience: Victarion leads the attack on the Shield Islands, demonstrating his prowess in battle. He struggles with his loyalty to Euron and his desire for personal glory and power.

key_characters.name: Euron Greyjoy
key_characters.description: The newly crowned King of the Iron Islands, known as the Crow's Eye.
key_characters.experience: Though not present in the battle, Euron's influence is felt throughout. His strategies and unconventional methods are a source of conflict for Victarion.

key_characters.name: Aeron Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Victarion's brother, a priest of the Drowned God.
key_characters.experience: Aeron opposes Euron's rule and tries to convince Victarion to overthrow him, but ultimately disappears.

key_characters.name: Talbert Serry
key_characters.description: Son and heir of the Lord of Southshield.
key_characters.experience: Talbert faces Victarion in single combat and is defeated, demonstrating Victarion's martial prowess.

conversation.scenario: The Iron Fleet attacks the Shield Islands, with Victarion Greyjoy leading the charge. Amid the chaos of battle, ships clash and warriors fight on blood-slicked decks. The air is thick with the smell of salt and iron, punctuated by the cries of combat. On one ship, Victarion spots a young lord in rose-emblazoned armor. The two lock eyes across the deck, recognizing each other as worthy opponents. The ship rocks beneath their feet as they prepare to engage in single combat, surrounded by the ongoing melee.
conversation.topic: Single combat between Victarion and Ser Talbert

key_characters.name: Victarion Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: I must prove myself as a true ironborn warrior, worthy of leading this fleet. This young lord looks eager for battle, but he'll soon learn the price of challenging the iron captain. I'll show Euron and all others that strength and steel are what truly matter, not tricks and schemes.

key_characters.name: Talbert Serry
key_characters.motivation: I must defend my family's honor and our lands. This ironborn brute may be strong, but I am quicker and more skilled with a blade. I'll prove myself worthy of being heir to Southshield by defeating this infamous raider. My victory here could turn the tide of this battle.

dialogues.message: [This young lord looks eager for battle. I'll give him what he seeks.] You! You of the rose! Be you the lord of Southshield?
[I must show no fear in the face of this ironborn captain.] (raises his visor) His son and heir. Ser Talbert Serry. And who are you, kraken?
[Let my name be the last he hears.] Your death. (charges towards Ser Talbert)
[I must strike first and fast.] (leaps to meet Victarion, swinging his longsword)
The clash of steel echoes across the deck as the two warriors engage in fierce combat. The ship rocks beneath their feet, adding to the challenge of the duel.
[This boy is quick, but I am stronger.] (deflects Serry's attacks with his axe and shield) I am quick as well, boy.
[I must find an opening in his defense.] (continues to press his attack, his longsword singing through the air)
[Time to end this.] (catches Serry's blade in his iron fist, crushing it) Go and get it. (forces Serry backwards over the side of the ship)
[I can't believe he caught my sword! This can't be happening.] My sword... (falls overboard into the bloodstained waters)
The sound of splashing water is quickly drowned out by the ongoing battle. Victarion stands victorious, his hand bleeding from where he caught Serry's blade.
[Another foe falls to the ironborn way. Euron may have his schemes, but true victory comes from steel and strength.] (turns to face the remaining enemies) Who's next?

plots.summary: Jaime Lannister arrives at Castle Darry with his forces, where he finds the castle under the control of his cousin Lancel. He observes the changes in the castle and its inhabitants, including Lancel's newfound religious fervor. Jaime interacts with various characters, including Pia, his squires, and the Frey family members now residing in Darry. He attends a feast where he learns about recent events and reflects on past experiences.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: The Lord Commander of the Kingsguard, known as the Kingslayer.
key_characters.experience: Jaime arrives at Darry, observes the changes in the castle and its inhabitants, and attends a feast. He reflects on past events and interacts with various characters, showcasing his complex personality and relationships.

key_characters.name: Lancel Lannister
key_characters.description: Jaime's cousin, now the Lord of Darry and deeply religious.
key_characters.experience: Though not directly present, Lancel's influence is felt throughout the castle. His religious fervor and absence from the feast are noted by Jaime, who considers his cousin's behavior foolish.

key_characters.name: Pia
key_characters.description: A serving girl from Harrenhal, now accompanying Jaime's group.
key_characters.experience: Pia's presence reminds Jaime of past events and temptations. He arranges for his squire Peck to spend time with her, showing a mix of pragmatism and concern for both of them.

key_characters.name: Amerei Frey
key_characters.description: Lancel's wife, the new Lady of Darry.
key_characters.experience: Amerei hosts the feast and interacts with Jaime, revealing information about recent events and her family's history.

conversation.scenario: In the lord's chambers of Castle Darry, Jaime Lannister bathes in a large tub, attended by his squires. The room is dimly lit, with the evening light filtering through narrow windows. The castle, recently taken by Lannister forces, bears signs of its tumultuous past. Outside, the sounds of soldiers and servants going about their duties can be heard. The air is thick with the smell of soap and steam, mingling with the lingering scents of war and recent conquest. Jaime, battle-worn and contemplative, observes his surroundings with a mixture of weariness and sharp awareness.
conversation.topic: Jaime's advice to Peck about Pia

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I'm weary of war and politics, but I must remain vigilant. Peck's interest in Pia needs addressing – it could be a distraction or a problem. I'll guide him, remembering my own past experiences. This situation with Lancel and the changes in Darry are concerning. I need to gather information and maintain control here.

key_characters.name: Peck
key_characters.motivation: Lord Jaime intimidates me, but I respect him deeply. I'm nervous about his presence and unsure how to act. Pia's beauty has caught my eye, but I don't know how to approach her. I hope I don't embarrass myself in front of my lord. I want to prove my worth as a squire.

dialogues.message: [I need to address this situation before it becomes a problem.] Fetch me soap and a stiff brush. Pia, you may leave us.
[I'm disappointed to leave, but I must obey.] (covers her mouth) Aye, m'lord. Thank you, m'lord.
Pia exits the room, leaving Jaime alone with his squires. The sound of water lapping against the sides of the tub fills the brief silence.
[Let's see how the boy reacts to this.] Do you want her?
[I can't believe Lord Jaime is asking me this. What should I say?] (turns beet red)

[The boy's reaction tells me everything I need to know.] If she'll have you, take her. She'll teach you a few things you'll find useful on your wedding night, I don't doubt, and you're not like to get a bastard by her.
[I'm both excited and nervous about this opportunity.] (stammers) Kind, my lord? How... how would I...?
[The boy needs more specific guidance.] Sweet words. Gentle touches. You don't want to wed her, but so long as you're abed treat her as you would your bride.
[This is all happening so fast. I need to know more.] My lord, I... where should I take her? There's never a place to... to...
[I can't help but be amused by his innocence.] (grins) We'll be at supper several hours. The straw looks lumpy, but it should serve.
[I can't believe he's suggesting we use Lord Lancel's bed!] (eyes widen) His lordship's bed?
[A little mischief won't hurt anyone.] You'll feel a lord yourself when you're done, if Pia knows her business. And someone ought to make some use of that miserable straw mattress.

plots.summary: Brienne, Podrick, Ser Hyle, and Septon Meribald arrive at the Quiet Isle, a religious community. They cross treacherous mudflats and meet Brother Narbert, who guides them to the Elder Brother. The group learns about the isle's history, its inhabitants, and recent events in the war-torn region. The Elder Brother reveals intriguing information about items washed up on their shores, including possible rubies from Rhaegar Targaryen's armor.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A female warrior on a quest to find the Hound.
key_characters.experience: Brienne leads the group to the Quiet Isle, seeking information about the Hound. She observes the surroundings and interacts with the brothers, showing curiosity about their way of life and recent events.

key_characters.name: Meribald
key_characters.description: A wandering septon guiding the group to the Quiet Isle.
key_characters.experience: Meribald leads the group across the mudflats, demonstrating his familiarity with the area and its customs. He introduces the group to the brothers and explains some of the isle's history.

key_characters.name: Elder Brother
key_characters.description: The leader of the religious community on the Quiet Isle.
key_characters.experience: The Elder Brother welcomes the group, provides them with refreshments, and shares information about the isle's unique position and the treasures that wash up on its shores.

conversation.scenario: The Quiet Isle, a secluded religious community, stands as a sanctuary amidst the war-torn Riverlands. Brienne of Tarth, accompanied by Podrick, Ser Hyle, and Septon Meribald, has just arrived at the Hermit's Hole after a treacherous journey across mudflats. The air is thick with the scent of salt and incense, and the sound of distant waves mingles with the soft chanting of brothers. The group, weary from travel, finds themselves in a modest chamber adorned with simple furnishings and driftwood artifacts. They've come seeking information about the Hound, but the isle's isolation and the mysterious aura of its inhabitants create an atmosphere of cautious curiosity.
conversation.topic: Introduction and discussion of recent events

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
