key_characters.motivation: Exhausted yet determined, Brienne surveys the room with keen interest. Her quest to find the Hound weighs heavily on her mind, but she's intrigued by the Isle's unique atmosphere. She's prepared to be diplomatic to gain information, while remaining alert for any signs of deception or danger. The Elder Brother's demeanor has caught her off-guard, and she's curious about what secrets this isolated community might hold.

key_characters.name: Elder Brother
key_characters.motivation: The Elder Brother is both welcoming and wary of these unexpected visitors. He's eager for news from the outside world but cautious about revealing too much about recent events or the isle's secrets. He's particularly intrigued by Brienne, sensing her noble purpose yet unusual role. He must balance hospitality with discretion, carefully weighing each word to protect his community while satisfying their guests' curiosity.

dialogues.message: [I must welcome them warmly while assessing their intentions.] It is always a glad day when our friends Meribald and Dog honor us with another visit. And new faces are always welcome. We see so few of them.
[I should explain why we've come.] Thank you for your hospitality, Elder Brother. We've come seeking information about the Hound.
[This is a delicate matter. I must be careful with my words.] I see. You must be thirsty. Please, have some of our sweet cider to wash the dust of travel from your throats.
[The cups are beautifully made. Perhaps a compliment will encourage him to be more forthcoming.] These cups are lovely. Did you make them yourselves?

[Her interest provides an opportunity to share more about our island.] My lady is too kind. All we do is cut and polish the wood. We are blessed here. Where the river meets the bay, the currents and the tides wrestle one against the other, and many strange and wondrous things are pushed toward us, to wash up on our shores.

[I should elaborate to pique their interest.] Driftwood is the least of it. We have found silver cups and iron pots, sacks of wool and bolts of silk, rusted helms and shining swords... aye, and rubies.
[This could be significant. I must know more.] Rhaegar's rubies?
[I must be cautious not to spread rumors or false hope.] It may be. Who can say? The battle was long leagues from here, but the river is tireless and patient.
[We're getting off track. I need to steer the conversation back to the Hound.] Elder Brother, we've heard reports of the Hound attacking Saltpans. Do you know anything about this?

[I must consider how much to reveal about the recent violence.] (sighs heavily) Saltpans has indeed suffered greatly. But perhaps we should speak of lighter matters for now. You must be weary from your journey.
[I'm curious about this place, but I shouldn't speak out of turn.] (looks around the room with wide eyes)

plots.summary: Cersei holds a late-night council meeting to address the threat of a thousand Ironborn ships attacking the Reach. Margaery Tyrell urges immediate action, while Cersei is dismissive and sees it as a potential ploy by Stannis. Loras Tyrell volunteers to lead an assault on Dragonstone, which Cersei accepts, secretly hoping for his demise. After the meeting, Cersei discusses future plans with Qyburn, including a mysterious new champion. The chapter ends with Cersei retiring to bed, reflecting on her past and current sleeping arrangements.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: The Queen Regent, manipulative and paranoid
key_characters.experience: Cersei presides over the council meeting, making decisions that suit her political agenda while inwardly despising the Tyrells. She hopes to use the Ironborn threat and Loras' mission to Dragonstone to her advantage.

key_characters.name: Margaery Tyrell
key_characters.description: The young queen, Tommen's wife
key_characters.experience: Margaery urgently advocates for action against the Ironborn threat, showing concern for her family's lands and pushing for the use of the Redwyne fleet.

key_characters.name: Loras Tyrell
key_characters.description: Margaery's brother, the Knight of Flowers
key_characters.experience: Loras volunteers to lead the assault on Dragonstone, displaying his characteristic bravery and eagerness for glory.

key_characters.name: Qyburn
key_characters.description: Cersei's confidant and former maester
key_characters.experience: Qyburn discusses secret plans with Cersei, including the creation of a mysterious new champion.

conversation.scenario: The Red Keep's throne room is dimly lit for a late-night emergency council meeting. Tension hangs in the air as news of the Ironborn attack on the Shield Islands has reached King's Landing. The small council members, including representatives from House Tyrell, have gathered to discuss this urgent threat. The Iron Throne looms ominously in the background, a symbol of power and contention. Cersei Lannister, as Queen Regent, presides over the meeting, her golden hair gleaming in the candlelight. The Tyrell siblings, Margaery and Loras, stand together, their concern for their homeland evident in their demeanor. The room is filled with a mix of fear, urgency, and political machinations.
conversation.topic: Response to the Ironborn attack on the Shield Islands

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: These Tyrells are a constant thorn in my side. I must use this Ironborn threat to my advantage, perhaps to weaken their position. I'll deflect their concerns and manipulate the situation to suit my needs. If I can get Loras out of the picture, it would be a significant win. I need to maintain control and appear authoritative while secretly relishing their discomfort.

key_characters.name: Margaery Tyrell
key_characters.motivation: The Reach is in danger, and Cersei seems dismissive. I must convince her of the urgency without appearing to challenge her authority directly. My family's lands and people are at risk, and we need immediate action. I'll push for involving my father and using our resources, but I fear Cersei's paranoia about Stannis might cloud her judgment. I need to be persistent yet cautious in my approach.

key_characters.name: Loras Tyrell
key_characters.motivation: This Ironborn threat is serious, and Cersei's not taking it seriously enough. I need to support Margaery and make Cersei understand the gravity of the situation. If she won't act to protect the Reach, perhaps I can volunteer for a mission that will both serve our interests and bring me glory. I'm ready to prove my worth and show that House Tyrell is indispensable to the realm's security.

dialogues.message: [I must make Cersei understand the gravity of the situation.] Your Grace, this must be answered fiercely! A thousand ships have attacked the Shield Islands!
[This presumptuous girl dares to tell me what I must do?] (tightening her neck) The Shield Islands belong to the Reach. It is for Highgarden to answer this.
[She's deflecting responsibility. I need to push harder.] Highgarden shall answer. We must send word to my lord father at Storm's End. At once.

[How dare she command me!] (with poisonous sweetness) And lift the siege? I have no doubt that Lord Stannis would be pleased by that. Have you been listening, my lady? If he can draw our eyes away from Dragonstone and Storm's End to these rocks...
[She's dismissing the threat to my home!] (gasping) Rocks? Did Your Grace say rocks?

[I must defend my sister and explain the gravity of the situation.] (placing a hand on Margaery's shoulder) If it please Your Grace, from those rocks the ironmen threaten Oldtown and the Arbor. With enough men they might even threaten Highgarden.
[Let's see how they handle this challenge.] (with false innocence) Truly? Why then, your brave brothers had best roust them off those rocks, and quickly.
[She's mocking us. I need to point out the flaw in her suggestion.] How would the queen suggest they accomplish that, without sufficient ships?

[Time to put this insolent boy in his place.] Highgarden sits above the Mander. You and your vassals command a thousand leagues of coast. Are there no fisherfolk along your shores? Do you have no pleasure barges, no ferries, no river galleys, no skiffs?
[She's being deliberately obtuse. I must remain calm.] Many and more, Your Grace. But such would be no match for the ironborn longships.
[Let's see how he handles this suggestion.] Highgarden has gold as well. You have my leave to hire sellsails from beyond the narrow sea.
[Is she serious? This is getting ridiculous.] (with contempt) Pirates out of Myr and Lys, you mean? The scum of the Free Cities?
[His insolence knows no bounds.] (with poisonous sweetness) Sad to say, all of us must deal with scum from time to time. Perhaps you have a better notion?
[This is my chance to take action.] Your Grace, let me take Dragonstone. The castle will be yours within a fortnight if I have to tear it down with my bare hands.

[Perfect. This fool has played right into my hands.] (kissing Loras on both cheeks) Your courage takes my breath away, Ser Loras. The command is yours. Swear to me that you shall not return until Dragonstone is Tommen's.

plots.summary: Jaime Lannister meets with his cousin Ser Daven Lannister at the siege of Riverrun. They discuss the ongoing siege, the Frey allies, and potential strategies. Jaime learns about the situation with Edmure Tully and the Blackfish. He decides to offer terms to end the siege peacefully. Afterwards, Jaime walks among the camp, reflecting on his comfort among soldiers and observing camp life.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: The main character, a one-handed knight and member of the Kingsguard.
key_characters.experience: Jaime meets with Ser Daven to discuss the siege of Riverrun. He aims to end the siege peacefully and return to King's Landing. He reflects on his comfort in military life compared to court.

key_characters.name: Daven Lannister
key_characters.description: Jaime's cousin, the new Warden of the West.
key_characters.experience: Daven provides Jaime with information about the siege and expresses frustration with the Freys. He discusses the challenges they face and his reluctance to be named Warden of the West.

conversation.scenario: In a military encampment outside Riverrun, Jaime Lannister's tent stands among a sea of others. The air is thick with tension and the smell of campfires. Inside, Jaime, the one-handed knight of the Kingsguard, meets with his cousin Ser Daven Lannister, the new Warden of the West. The siege of Riverrun has been ongoing, with the Blackfish holding out inside the castle. The Lannister and Frey forces surround the stronghold, but morale is low and supplies are dwindling. The cousins gather to discuss the state of the siege and potential strategies to bring it to a swift conclusion.
conversation.topic: The state of the siege and potential strategies

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must end this siege quickly and return to Cersei in King's Landing. The situation seems more complex than anticipated, but I'm determined to find a peaceful resolution if possible. I need to gather all the information I can from Daven and formulate a plan. Perhaps offering generous terms to the Blackfish could work. My experience in warfare might prove useful here.

key_characters.name: Daven Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I'm relieved Jaime is here to help with this frustrating siege. The Freys are unreliable allies, and our resources are stretched thin. I hope Jaime's presence will bring a fresh perspective and perhaps a solution to our problems. I need to convey the gravity of our situation without seeming incompetent. Maybe Jaime can deal with the Freys more effectively than I have.

dialogues.message: [I need to get straight to business.] I need to know what I can expect to find at Riverrun.
[Where to begin with this mess?] The siege drags on. The Blackfish sits inside the castle, we sit outside in our camps. Bloody boring, if you want the truth.
[I need more specific details.] Tell me of your dispositions, coz.

[I hope Jaime appreciates the challenges we face.] We have the castle well encircled. Ser Ryman and the Freys are north of the Tumblestone. South of Red Fork sits Lord Emmon, with Ser Forley Prester and with what remains of your old host, plus the river lords who came over to us after the Red Wedding. A sullen lot, I don't mind saying. Good for sulking in their tents, but not much more. Mine own camp is between the rivers, facing the moat and Riverrun's main gates.
[Starvation might be our best option.] Can we starve the castle out?

[Unfortunately, that won't work.] (shakes head) The Blackfish expelled all the useless mouths from Riverrun and picked this country clean. He has enough stores to keep man and horse alive for two full years.
[This situation is more complicated than I thought.] And how well are we provisioned?

[Our own situation is not much better.] So long as there are fish in the rivers, we won't starve, though I don't know how we're going to feed the horses. The Freys are hauling food and fodder down from the Twins, but Ser Ryman claims he does not have enough to share, so we must forage for ourselves. Half the men I send off to look for food do not return. Some are deserting. Others we find ripening under trees, with ropes about their necks.
[This siege needs to end quickly.] I mean to offer him generous terms. If he could end this siege without bloodshed, then it could not be said that he had taken up arms against House Tully.
[I doubt words will be enough, but I'll let Jaime try.] You are welcome to try, my lord, but I doubt that words will win the day. We need to storm the castle.
[I need to resolve this quickly and return to King's Landing.] Whatever we do needs to be done quickly. My place is back at King's Landing, with the king.

The tension in the air is palpable as the two cousins discuss the complex siege situation. The flickering light from the braziers casts dancing shadows across their faces, emphasizing the gravity of their conversation.

plots.summary: Arya Stark, now known as Cat of the Canals, lives in Braavos with Brusco's family, selling shellfish and learning the ways of the city. She continues her training with the Faceless Men, reporting to the kindly man about the secrets she learns. She struggles with her identity, experiencing wolf dreams that remind her of her past as Arya Stark.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.description: A young girl disguised as an orphan, training with the Faceless Men in Braavos.
key_characters.experience: Cat struggles with her dual identity as she lives and works in Braavos, selling shellfish and learning secrets for the Faceless Men. She experiences wolf dreams that connect her to her past as Arya Stark.

key_characters.name: The Kindly Man
key_characters.description: A Faceless Man who oversees Cat's training.
key_characters.experience: He regularly questions Cat about what she has learned and reminds her of her duty to serve the Many-Faced God.

key_characters.name: Brusco
key_characters.description: The man Cat lives and works with in Braavos.
key_characters.experience: Brusco owns the boat and business that Cat helps with, selling shellfish in the city.

conversation.scenario: In the enigmatic House of Black and White in Braavos, a sanctuary dedicated to the Many-Faced God, Cat of the Canals returns from her daily routine of selling shellfish. The air is heavy with the scent of candles and a lingering essence of death. Dim lighting casts long shadows across the stone floors, creating an atmosphere of secrecy and mystery. Cat, formerly known as Arya Stark, has been living a double life - an orphan by day, an assassin-in-training by night. She approaches the Kindly Man, her mentor, in a quiet hall for her regular debriefing, her footsteps echoing softly in the stillness.
conversation.topic: Cat's progress in gathering information and her struggle with identity

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.motivation: I'm eager to prove my worth to the Faceless Men, but the wolf dreams keep tugging at my past. I've gathered valuable information today and must report it accurately. Yet, I struggle to fully embrace being 'no one' as my training demands. Part of me still clings to Arya Stark, and I fear the Kindly Man will sense this internal conflict.

key_characters.name: The Kindly Man
key_characters.motivation: This girl shows promise, but her past identity still lingers. I must test her thoroughly - both her ability to gather information and her progress in becoming 'no one'. Her resistance to letting go of Arya Stark concerns me. Today's questioning will reveal how far she's come and how much further she needs to go in her training.

dialogues.message: [I must assess her progress.] What do you know that you did not know when you left us?

[I need to prove my worth and hide my true identity.] I know what Blind Beqqo puts in the hot sauce he uses on his oysters. I know the mummers at the Blue Lantern are going to do The Lord of the Woeful Countenance and the mummers at the Ship mean to answer with Seven Drunken Oarsmen. I know the bookseller Lotho Lornel sleeps in the house of Tradesman-Captain Moredo Prestayn whenever the honorable tradesman-captain is away on a voyage, and moves out whenever the Vixen comes home.
[She's learning, but I must push her further.] It is good to know these things. And who are you?
[I must be no one, but it's so hard to forget who I am.] No one.
[She's still holding onto her past. I must continue to challenge her.] You lie. You are Cat of the canals, I know you well. Go and sleep, child. On the morrow you must serve.
[I must obey, but part of me resists.] All men must serve.
The dark, quiet halls of the House of Black and White loom around them, filled with the presence of the Many-Faced God. The air is thick with the scent of candles and death.

plots.name: Aeron Greyjoy
plots.description: The Damphair, a priest of the Drowned God and brother to Balon Greyjoy.
plots.summary: Aeron learns of Balon's death, reflects on his past, and calls for a kingsmoot to choose the next ruler, opposing Euron's claim to the throne.

plots.name: Aeron Greyjoy
plots.description: The Damphair, a priest of the Drowned God and youngest brother of Balon Greyjoy.
plots.summary: Aeron leads the religious rituals of drowning and reborn, learns of Balon's death, reflects on his past, and calls for a Kingsmoot to choose the next ruler of the Iron Islands.

plots.name: Aeron Greyjoy
plots.description: Victarion's brother, a priest of the Drowned God.
plots.summary: Aeron opposes Euron's rule and tries to convince Victarion to overthrow him, but ultimately disappears.

conversations.name: Aeron Greyjoy
conversations.thought: I must ensure our next ruler follows the Drowned God's ways. A kingsmoot is the only path forward, returning to our old traditions. I cannot let Euron or any unworthy successor take the Seastone Chair.

conversations.name: Aeron Greyjoy
conversations.thought: I am the Damphair, vessel of the Drowned God's will. As I perform this sacred rite, I feel His power coursing through me. The boy must be reborn in the faith, stronger and truer. Yet, I sense a disturbance approaching—something that may challenge my convictions and the future of our people. I must remain unwavering in my faith and purpose.

utterances.message: [The Drowned God has shown me the way. I must lead our people to the right path.] We were born from the sea, and to the sea we all return. The Storm God in his wrath plucked Balon from his castle and cast him down, and now he feasts beneath the waves in the Drowned God's watery halls. (raises his hands) Balon is dead! The king is dead! Yet a king will come again! For what is dead may never die, but rises again, harder and stronger! A king will rise!
[The Drowned God's will must be done.] The Drowned God shall decide who sits the Seastone Chair. Kneel, that I might bless you.

Lord God who drowned for us, let Meldred your servant be born again from the sea. Bless him with salt, bless him with stone, bless him with steel. What is dead may never die, but rises again, harder and stronger.

[The old ways must be restored.] The Drowned God will tell you, but not here. Look not to me, nor to the laws of men, but to the sea. Raise your sails and unship your oars, my lord, and take yourself to Old Wyk. You, and all the captains and the kings.

[This is the will of the Drowned God.] Go not to Pyke, to bow before the godless, nor to Harlaw, to consort with scheming women. Point your prow toward Old Wyk, where stood the Grey King's Hall. In the name of the Drowned God I summon you. I summon all of you! Leave your halls and hovels, your castles and your keeps, and return to Nagga's hill to make a kingsmoot!

[The Old Way is the only way.] (interrupting passionately) ...too long a time! Yet in the dawn of days the ironborn chose their own kings, raising up the worthiest amongst them. It is time we returned to the Old Way, for only that shall make us great again.

[The Drowned God's will flows through me.] (pushing the struggling youth down) Have courage. We came from the sea, and to the sea we must return. Open your mouth and drink deep of god's blessing. Fill your lungs with water, that you may die and be reborn.
[The boy's faith is weak. I must guide him.] It does no good to fight.

[I sense their presence, but the ritual must be completed.] (to his drowned men) Lord God who drowned for us, let Emmond your servant be reborn from the sea, as you were. Bless him with salt, bless him with stone, bless him with steel.
[Their presence bodes ill. I must know their purpose.] Have you come to be drowned, my lords?
[I sense the weight of their words.] Speak, then. If there are tidings that concern me, speak them now.
[My world shifts beneath me, but I must remain strong.] (stoically) Tell me the manner of my brother's death.
[The Storm God's work, no doubt.] Was the storm raging when he fell?

[I must interpret this for the faithful.] The Storm God cast him down. (to his followers) My brother Balon made us great again, which earned the Storm God's wrath. He feasts now in the Drowned God's watery halls, with mermaids to attend his every want. It shall be for us who remain behind in this dry and dismal vale to finish his great work.

Aeron Greyjoy.profile:
Aeron Greyjoy, known as the Damphair, is a complex and pivotal figure in the Iron Islands' political and religious landscape. As the youngest brother of King Balon Greyjoy and a devout priest of the Drowned God, Aeron wields significant spiritual influence among the ironborn. His transformation from a weak, carousing youth to a zealous, hardened religious leader forms the cornerstone of his character.

Physically, Aeron is often seen standing waist-deep in the frigid waters of the Iron Islands, his appearance marked by the harsh elements of his environment. His fervent devotion to the Drowned God is evident in his actions and demeanor, as he regularly performs drowning rituals to initiate new followers into the faith.

Aeron's core motivations stem from his unwavering belief in the Drowned God and the Old Way of the ironborn. Upon learning of King Balon's death, he sees it as a divine sign and takes decisive action. Rejecting both Euron and Asha as potential successors, Aeron calls for a kingsmoot, an ancient tradition of choosing a ruler, believing it to be the will of the Drowned God.

His relationship with his family is complex, particularly with his brother Euron, whom he vehemently opposes. Aeron's dedication to tradition and religious orthodoxy puts him at odds with the ambitions of his potential successors, driving him to rally the ironborn to return to their roots.

Throughout "A Feast for Crows," Aeron's actions significantly impact the political landscape of the Iron Islands. His call for a kingsmoot sets in motion a chain of events that will determine the future leadership and direction of his people. His ability to inspire and guide the ironborn through religious rhetoric and ritual demonstrates his considerable influence.

Aeron's character arc reveals a man grappling with the changing tides of power while clinging steadfastly to his faith and traditions. His disappearance later in the story adds an element of mystery to his fate, leaving readers to wonder about the consequences of his actions and the true extent of his influence on the Iron Islands' future.

plots.name: Alleras
plots.description: Also known as the Sphinx, a skilled acolyte at the Citadel from Dorne.
plots.summary: Alleras participates in discussions about dragons and demonstrates his archery skills. He seems more knowledgeable and accomplished than his peers.

Alleras.profile:
Alleras, known by the moniker "the Sphinx," is an intriguing and skilled acolyte at the Citadel in Oldtown. Hailing from Dorne, Alleras stands out among his peers for his exceptional abilities and knowledge. His background as a Dornishman adds a layer of diversity to the predominantly Westerosi student body at the Citadel.

Physically, Alleras is described as having the typical Dornish features, though specific details are limited in the provided information. His most notable attribute is his extraordinary skill in archery, which he demonstrates with impressive accuracy, setting him apart from other students.

Intellectually curious and well-informed, Alleras actively participates in discussions about dragons and other mysterious topics at the Citadel. His contributions to these conversations suggest a depth of knowledge that surpasses that of his fellow acolytes, hinting at a sharp mind and possibly access to uncommon information.

While Alleras's core motivations are not explicitly stated, his presence at the Citadel indicates a strong desire for learning and potentially becoming a maester. His advanced skills and knowledge suggest he may have ulterior motives or a unique background that drives his pursuits.

In the context of the story, Alleras serves as a somewhat enigmatic figure, adding intrigue to the Citadel subplot. His superior abilities and insights make him a character of interest, potentially holding secrets or playing a larger role in unfolding events related to the reemergence of magic and dragons in the world of Westeros.

plots.name: Amerei Frey
plots.description: Lancel's wife, the new Lady of Darry.
plots.summary: Amerei hosts the feast and interacts with Jaime, revealing information about recent events and her family's history.

Amerei Frey.profile:
Amerei Frey, also known as Lady of Darry, is a minor yet intriguing character in George R.R. Martin's "A Feast for Crows." As the wife of Lancel Lannister, she finds herself in a position of newfound power at Castle Darry. Amerei's background is rooted in the politically ambitious House Frey, known for their numerous alliances through marriage.

While detailed physical descriptions are limited, Amerei's personality shines through her interactions. She appears to be gregarious and outgoing, comfortable in her role as hostess during the feast attended by Jaime Lannister. Her willingness to share information about recent events and her family's history suggests a certain openness and desire for social connection.

Amerei's marriage to Lancel Lannister is a key aspect of her character, representing the political maneuvering typical of Westerosi nobility. This union has elevated her status, making her the Lady of Darry, a position that comes with new responsibilities and challenges.

Throughout the narrative, Amerei serves as a window into the changing dynamics at Castle Darry, particularly in light of Lancel's religious transformation. Her presence and interactions provide valuable context for the reader, offering insights into the local politics and recent history of the area.

While Amerei's character arc is not extensively developed in the book, her role as Lady of Darry and her connections to both House Frey and House Lannister position her as a potentially significant figure in the complex web of alliances and power struggles that characterize Martin's world.

plots.name: Areo Hotah
plots.description: Captain of Guards, loyal to Prince Doran.
plots.summary: Hotah serves as Doran's protector and confidant, observing the political tensions and ready to defend the prince if necessary.

plots.name: Areo Hotah
plots.description: Captain of Prince Doran's guard, loyal and dutiful.
plots.summary: Intercepts Arianne's group, kills Ser Arys Oakheart, and captures Arianne on Prince Doran's orders.

conversations.name: Areo Hotah
conversations.thought: I feel the weight of my duty heavily upon me. Prince Doran's orders are clear, but I take no pleasure in this task. I must end this rebellion swiftly and with minimal bloodshed if possible. The princess must be captured alive, but I will not hesitate to use force if necessary. I hope she surrenders peacefully.

utterances.message: [I must act swiftly to end this rebellion.] Yield, my princess, else we must slay all but the child and yourself, by your father's word.
[I must end this quickly.] (swings his longaxe, decapitating Ser Arys) After him. He must not escape. After him!
[I feel pity for the princess, but I must follow my orders.] The prince said I must bring you back to Sunspear. I am sorry, little princess.

Areo Hotah.profile:
Areo Hotah is the steadfast Captain of Guards for Prince Doran Martell of Dorne in George R.R. Martin's "A Feast for Crows." A man of unwavering loyalty and duty, Hotah serves as both protector and confidant to the ailing Prince Doran. His role extends beyond mere physical protection, as he stands as a silent observer of the political tensions that simmer in Dorne following the death of Oberyn Martell.

Hotah's most defining characteristic is his absolute devotion to Prince Doran's commands. This dedication is put to the test when he is ordered to intercept and thwart Princess Arianne Martell's plot to crown Myrcella Baratheon as Queen. In a pivotal moment, Hotah demonstrates his resolve and combat prowess by confronting Arianne's group on the banks of the Greenblood river. With a heavy heart but steady hand, he executes his duty, killing Ser Arys Oakheart of the Kingsguard and capturing Arianne.

Armed with his signature longaxe, Hotah is a formidable warrior, capable of decisive action when required. His internal thoughts reveal a man who takes no pleasure in violence but will not hesitate to use force to fulfill his sworn duties. This internal conflict is evident in his pity for Arianne even as he follows orders to bring her back to Sunspear.

Hotah's character serves as a lens through which readers observe the complex political machinations of Dorne. His unwavering loyalty to Prince Doran places him at the center of key events, making him an essential figure in the unfolding drama of Dorne's response to the wider conflicts in Westeros.

plots.name: Arianne Martell
plots.description: The heir to Dorne, seducing Ser Arys and plotting to crown Myrcella.
plots.summary: Arianne uses her sexuality and political arguments to manipulate Ser Arys into supporting her plan to crown Myrcella as Queen of the Seven Kingdoms.

plots.name: Arianne Martell
plots.description: Princess of Dorne, daughter of Prince Doran Martell, ambitious and cunning.
plots.summary: Leads the plot to crown Myrcella as Queen, challenging her brother's claim to Dorne. She manipulates her companions and plans to raise Dorne in rebellion against the Iron Throne.

plots.name: Arianne Martell
plots.description: Princess of Dorne, daughter of Prince Doran Martell, ambitious and cunning.
plots.summary: Leads the plot to crown Myrcella, which fails. She is captured and brought back to Sunspear, devastated by the outcome and questioning how her father knew of her plans.

conversations.name: Arianne Martell
conversations.thought: Arys is putty in my hands, but I must tread carefully. I'll use my charms and his conflicted loyalties to sway him. My goal is to convince him to support Myrcella's claim to the throne. I must navigate his sense of duty and manipulate his affection for both Myrcella and myself to achieve my aims.

conversations.name: Arianne Martell
conversations.thought: I must remain calm and in control. This is my chance to secure my claim on Dorne and change the fate of the Seven Kingdoms. Myrcella is the key, and I need to manipulate everyone carefully. Ser Arys's love for me is a powerful tool, but Darkstar's unpredictability worries me. I must learn more about the situation in King's Landing to adjust our plans accordingly.

conversations.name: Arianne Martell
conversations.thought: Panic and disbelief course through me. My carefully laid plans are crumbling before my eyes. How did my father discover our plot? I must find a way to salvage this situation, to protect Myrcella and myself. Perhaps I can still negotiate or find an escape route. I need to stay calm and think quickly.

utterances.message: [He's wavering already. I can use this.] (steps out naked from behind the door) Are you certain you wish to leave so soon, ser? I still have much to teach you.
[I need to remind him of the pleasure we share.] You seemed glad enough for the lessons at the time, ser. Are you certain you are not off to some other bed, some other woman?
[Now to plant the seed of doubt about his duty.] That poxy bitch? I know her. Dry as dust between the legs, and her kisses leave you bleeding. Let duty sleep alone for once, and stay with me tonight.
[Time to bring up Myrcella and gauge his reaction.] With your other princess. You will make me jealous. I think you love her more than me.
[Now to introduce the idea of crowning Myrcella.] A daughter you would let be despoiled of her rights and locked away in prison?
[I need to push harder.] What would you have me do?
[Now for the final push.] And her rights. Set a crown upon her head.
[I must take control of the situation and set the stage for our journey.] Welcome, Your Grace. These are my true and loyal friends, and they would be yours as well.
[I must be careful with my words, not to frighten her too much.] He fell in with evil men, Your Grace, and I fear they have conspired with him to steal your throne.
[Perfect, she's questioning it herself.] ...younger than you, surely?
[Now to plant the seed.] That means the Iron Throne by rights is yours. Your brother is only a little boy, you must not blame him. He has bad counselors... but you have friends.
[What news does he bring?] Come. (leads Ser Arys away from the others) How much does the child know?
[Good, she trusts him. Now for the important news.] Is there anything else I should know?

[This is perfect for our plans!] Has she? A woman on the Iron Throne? (smiles) This is all to the good. If the lords of the Seven Kingdoms grow accustomed to Queen Cersei's rule, it will be that much easier for them to bend their knees to Queen Myrcella.
[He's dangerous, but we need him.] And what is it I want, ser?
[He's not wrong, but there's more to it.] I want justice.
[He underestimates me.] The lion's dead. Who knows which cub the lioness prefers?
[I can't believe this is happening. I must try to escape.] Away! (turns to Ser Arys) Arys, protect the princess—
[He's going to get himself killed!] (thinks) You reckless fool, what do you think you're doing?
[Horror and disbelief overwhelm me as I watch Arys charge to his death.] Noooo! (shrieks) No, please, this was not supposed to happen.
[I feel numb with shock and grief.] (falls to her knees, sobbing) How could he know? I was so careful. How could he know?
[Confusion and despair overwhelm me.] Someone told. (looks up at Hotah) Someone always tells.

Arianne Martell.profile:
Arianne Martell is the ambitious and cunning Princess of Dorne, daughter of Prince Doran Martell. As the heir to Dorne, Arianne is a complex character driven by a desire for power, justice, and recognition. Physically alluring, she uses her sexuality as a tool to manipulate others, particularly evident in her seduction of Ser Arys Oakheart, a Kingsguard knight sworn to celibacy.

Arianne's core motivation stems from her belief that she is being passed over as heir to Dorne in favor of her younger brother, Quentyn. This fuels her ambitious plot to crown Princess Myrcella Baratheon as Queen of the Seven Kingdoms, challenging the current political order and asserting Dorne's power. Her scheme demonstrates her political acumen and willingness to take significant risks.

Throughout the story, Arianne showcases her ability to manipulate others, using a combination of charm, sexuality, and political arguments to sway key figures like Ser Arys to her cause. She is skilled at playing on others' conflicted loyalties and desires to achieve her aims.

However, Arianne's plans ultimately fail when her father, Prince Doran, intercepts her plot. This failure leads to a pivotal moment in her character arc, as she watches Ser Arys die in a futile attempt to protect her. The devastating outcome of her scheme forces Arianne to confront the consequences of her actions and question her understanding of the political landscape.

Arianne's character is marked by a complex interplay of ambition, naivety, and a genuine desire for justice. Her failed plot and subsequent capture by her father's forces represent a significant turning point, likely to impact her future development and understanding of power dynamics within Dorne and the wider realm of Westeros.

plots.name: Arya Stark
plots.description: A young girl from Westeros, seeking the Faceless Men in Braavos.
plots.summary: Arya arrives in Braavos, observes the city, and enters the House of Black and White. She interacts with the priest, reveals her true identity, and shows her fearlessness.

plots.name: Arya Stark
plots.description: Young girl training to become a Faceless Man, struggling with her identity.
plots.summary: Continues her training, learns about the Faceless Men's history, hides Needle instead of discarding it, and begins learning Braavosi and lie detection.

plots.name: Arya Stark
plots.description: A young girl disguised as an orphan, training with the Faceless Men in Braavos.
plots.summary: Cat struggles with her dual identity as she lives and works in Braavos, selling shellfish and learning secrets for the Faceless Men. She experiences wolf dreams that connect her to her past as Arya Stark.

conversations.name: Arya Stark
conversations.thought: I've finally reached the House of Black and White. I must stay strong and find Jaqen H'ghar, no matter what. This place is strange and intimidating, but I can't show fear. I'll use my fake names if I need to, but I'm prepared to reveal my true identity if it comes to that. I need answers and a new path forward.

conversations.name: Arya Stark
conversations.thought: I'm torn between my desire to learn the secrets of the Faceless Men and my reluctance to let go of my identity. Needle is hidden, but can I truly become No One? I want to prove my strength and determination, yet I fear losing myself entirely. I must convince the Kindly Man of my commitment while preserving my core self.

conversations.name: Arya Stark
conversations.thought: I'm eager to prove my worth to the Faceless Men, but the wolf dreams keep tugging at my past. I've gathered valuable information today and must report it accurately. Yet, I struggle to fully embrace being 'no one' as my training demands. Part of me still clings to Arya Stark, and I fear the Kindly Man will sense this internal conflict.

utterances.message: [I need to be cautious but get answers.] A place of peace?
[I don't understand all these gods.] Is he like the southron god, the one with seven faces?
[I need to focus on why I'm here.] I only came to find Jaqen H'ghar.
[I should use my fake name.] Salty. I come from Saltpans, by the Trident.
[He knows I'm lying. I'll try another name.] Squab.
[I can't keep lying. I must tell the truth.] Arya. I am Arya, of House Stark.
[I feel a sense of panic at the thought of losing my possessions.] They're mine.
[I must give the answer he expects.] No one.
[I can't leave, but I don't want to give up everything.] I don't have any gold.
[I must convince him I'm strong enough.] I'm strong. As strong as you. I'm hard.
[I feel defiant, but also scared.] I could if I wanted to.
[I will prove him wrong.] I can give up anything I want!

[I need to prove my worth and hide my true identity.] I know what Blind Beqqo puts in the hot sauce he uses on his oysters. I know the mummers at the Blue Lantern are going to do The Lord of the Woeful Countenance and the mummers at the Ship mean to answer with Seven Drunken Oarsmen. I know the bookseller Lotho Lornel sleeps in the house of Tradesman-Captain Moredo Prestayn whenever the honorable tradesman-captain is away on a voyage, and moves out whenever the Vixen comes home.
[I must be no one, but it's so hard to forget who I am.] No one.
[I must obey, but part of me resists.] All men must serve.

Arya Stark.profile:
Arya Stark is a young, resilient girl from House Stark of Westeros, whose journey takes her far from her homeland to the mysterious city of Braavos. Driven by a fierce determination and a thirst for vengeance, Arya seeks out the Faceless Men, a secretive order of assassins, at the House of Black and White.

Physically small but mentally tough, Arya possesses a strong will and adaptability that have helped her survive numerous hardships. Her appearance is nondescript, allowing her to blend in and assume different identities – a skill that becomes crucial in her training.

Arya's core motivation is a complex mix of survival, revenge, and a search for purpose after the destruction of her family. She clings to her identity as a Stark, symbolized by her hidden sword Needle, even as she tries to embrace the teachings of the Faceless Men.

In Braavos, Arya begins her training at the House of Black and White, where she encounters the enigmatic Kindly Man. Her journey involves learning Braavosi, detecting lies, and understanding the history of the Faceless Men. However, she struggles with the fundamental tenet of becoming "No One," as required by the order.

Arya's character arc in this part of the story revolves around the tension between her desire to gain the skills of the Faceless Men and her reluctance to fully let go of her past and identity. This internal conflict is evident in her interactions with the Kindly Man and her secret retention of Needle.

Her experiences in Braavos mark a significant turning point in her development, challenging her understanding of self and pushing her to confront the true cost of the path she has chosen. As she navigates this new world, Arya must decide how much of herself she is willing to sacrifice in pursuit of her goals.

plots.name: Asha Greyjoy
plots.description: Balon Greyjoy's daughter, seeking to claim the Seastone Chair.
plots.summary: Asha arrives at Ten Towers to gather support for her claim. She learns of the kingsmoot and decides to attend despite warnings. She strategizes on how to win support and deals with personal relationships.

plots.name: Asha Greyjoy
plots.description: Daughter of Balon Greyjoy, niece to Victarion and Euron.
plots.summary: Asha proposes a shared rule with Victarion, demonstrating her political acumen and ambition. She warns him about the challenges they face and Euron's popularity.

conversations.name: Asha Greyjoy
conversations.thought: I must secure my claim to the Seastone Chair and continue my father's legacy. Uncle Rodrik's support could be crucial. I'm determined to prove myself worthy as a leader, despite being a woman in a male-dominated society. The news of a kingsmoot is unexpected, but I must adapt quickly and use this to my advantage.

conversations.name: Asha Greyjoy
conversations.thought: Victarion is my best chance to prevent Euron's rule, but he's stubborn and set in the old ways. I must convince him that times are changing and that we need a new approach to secure our future. My proposal for shared rule is risky, but necessary. I'll appeal to his pride, his sense of duty, and if needed, remind him of Euron's treachery. The Iron Islands' fate hangs in the balance.

utterances.message: [I need to show strength and determination.] Nuncle, I've come to gather support for my claim to the Seastone Chair. (looks around the library) I see you're still surrounded by your books.
[This changes everything, but I can't show weakness.] (laughs) A kingsmoot? Is this some jape, or does he mean it truly?
[I must seize this opportunity.] And miss the first kingsmoot called in... how long has it been, Nuncle?
[I won't let him discourage me.] I have the best claim. I am the heir of Balon's body.
[I feel a pang of guilt, but I can't let it stop me.] I know the risks, Nuncle. But I must try. I am no Gwynesse, content to complain about what might have been.
[I'm touched by his offer, but my mind is made up.] Ten Towers? Would that I could. But it's my father's seat I want, not yours. I'll sit the Seastone Chair.
[He'll come around eventually.] Let me know if he should find another page. (leaves the library, determined to prepare for the kingsmoot)
[I must approach this carefully. Victarion is stubborn, but I need his support.] Nuncle, hear me. I will place the driftwood crown upon your brow myself . . . if you will agree to share the rule.

[He's not outright rejecting the idea. There's hope.] Then let my nuncle sit. I will stand behind you, to guard your back and whisper in your ear. No king can rule alone. Even when the dragons sat the Iron Throne, they had men to help them. The King's Hands. Let me be your Hand, Nuncle.

[I need to appeal to his practical side.] To end this war before this war ends us. We have won all that we are like to win . . . and stand to lose all just as quick, unless we make a peace. I have shown Lady Glover every courtesy, and she swears her lord will treat with me. If we hand back Deepwood Motte, Torrhen's Square, and Moat Cailin, she says, the northmen will cede us Sea Dragon Point and all the Stony Shore.

[He's not seeing the bigger picture. I must make him understand.] When longships learn to row through trees, perhaps. A fisherman may hook a grey leviathan, but it will drag him down to death unless he cuts it loose. The north is too large for us to hold, and too full of northmen.
[He's not listening. I need to change tactics.] I know a man who needs House Harlaw, though.
[This is unexpected. I need to reassess.] (taken aback) Lord Rodrik rules House Harlaw.

[He's not seeing the threat Euron poses. I must warn him.] Some men look larger at a distance. Walk amongst the cookfires if you dare, and listen. They are not telling tales of your strength, nor of my famous beauty. They talk only of the Crow's Eye; the far places he has seen, the women he has raped and the men he's killed, the cities he has sacked, the way he burnt Lord Tywin's fleet at Lannisport...
[I've struck a nerve. I must press on.] (puts her hand on his arm) The Crow's Eye hatched the scheme. And killed your wife as well... did he not?
[I can see the pain in his eyes. Perhaps there's still a chance to sway him.] ...so long as Balon lived?
[He's in pain, but I must press my advantage.] I am sorry for you, and sorrier for her... but you leave me small choice but to claim the Seastone Chair myself.
[He's made his choice. There's nothing more I can do here.] It is. (leaves)

Asha Greyjoy.profile:
Asha Greyjoy is a formidable and ambitious figure in the world of "A Song of Ice and Fire." The daughter of Balon Greyjoy, former King of the Iron Islands, Asha stands out as a rare female leader in the male-dominated ironborn society. Known for her cunning, political acumen, and skill as a reaver, she challenges traditional gender roles within her culture.

In "A Feast for Crows," Asha emerges as a strong contender for the Seastone Chair following her father's death. Her decision to participate in the kingsmoot, an ancient method of choosing a new king, demonstrates her determination and willingness to break with tradition. Asha's approach to leadership blends ironborn values with a more progressive outlook, as seen in her proposal to make peace with the North and her offer to share rule with her uncle Victarion.

Physically capable and mentally sharp, Asha navigates the treacherous waters of Iron Islands politics with confidence. She's not afraid to stand up to powerful men like her uncles Rodrik Harlaw and Victarion Greyjoy, using a mix of charm, reason, and bold assertions to further her goals. Her relationship with her family is complex; she respects her heritage but is willing to challenge outdated notions for the greater good of the Iron Islands.

Asha's core motivation is to secure leadership of the Iron Islands and guide them towards a more sustainable future. She recognizes the limitations of their current way of life and seeks to adapt while maintaining their fierce independence. This puts her at odds with more traditional figures like Victarion and the dangerous, charismatic Euron "Crow's Eye" Greyjoy.

Throughout the story, Asha's character arc reveals her growth as a leader and her struggle to be taken seriously in a society that values physical strength and adheres to patriarchal norms. Her ability to garner support and her strategic thinking make her a significant player in the power dynamics of the Iron Islands, even as she faces steep challenges in her quest for the crown.

plots.name: Balon Greyjoy
plots.description: The recently deceased King of the Iron Islands.
plots.summary: Balon's death sets the stage for the succession crisis and the call for a kingsmoot.

plots.name: Balon Greyjoy
plots.description: The recently deceased King of the Iron Islands.
plots.summary: Balon's death sets the plot in motion, creating a succession crisis that Aeron seeks to resolve through a Kingsmoot.

Balon Greyjoy.profile:
Balon Greyjoy, the recently deceased King of the Iron Islands, stands as a pivotal figure whose death catalyzes major events in "A Feast for Crows." A hard and unyielding man, Balon embodied the Iron Islands' ancient way of life, championing their culture of reaving and pillaging. His reign was marked by a failed rebellion against the Iron Throne years prior, which ended in defeat but did not break his spirit or ambition.

Balon's sudden demise creates a power vacuum in the Iron Islands, setting the stage for a succession crisis that ripples throughout the narrative. His passing prompts his brother, Aeron Greyjoy (the Damphair), to call for a Kingsmoot – an ancient method of choosing a new ruler – rather than allowing the throne to pass directly to Balon's chosen heir.

The legacy of Balon Greyjoy looms large over the Iron Islands, influencing the actions and motivations of key characters such as his daughter Asha and his brother Euron. His death serves as a crucial plot device, igniting political intrigue and power struggles that will shape the future of the Iron Islands and potentially impact the broader conflicts in Westeros.

Though Balon himself does not appear directly in "A Feast for Crows," his influence and the consequences of his reign and death are felt throughout the book, making him a significant figure whose actions continue to affect the story's trajectory even after his passing.

plots.name: Brienne of Tarth
plots.description: A warrior woman on a quest, cautious and mistrustful of their guide.
plots.summary: Brienne takes precautions to protect herself and their resources, showing her wariness of Nimble Dick. She reflects on her past and maintains a stoic demeanor throughout the journey.

plots.name: Brienne of Tarth
plots.description: A female knight searching for Sansa Stark.
plots.summary: Brienne travels towards Duskendale, questioning various people about Sansa's whereabouts and reflecting on the difficulties of her quest.

plots.name: Brienne of Tarth
plots.description: A tall, strong woman on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
plots.summary: Brienne investigates leads in Duskendale, gathers information about Dontos Hollard and a potential sighting in Maidenpool, and reflects on her oath to Catelyn Stark.

plots.name: Brienne of Tarth
plots.description: A tall, strong woman on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
plots.summary: Brienne travels cautiously, questioning people about Sansa's whereabouts. She remains vigilant against potential threats and reflects on her past experiences and fighting abilities.

plots.name: Brienne of Tarth
plots.description: A tall, strong woman knight on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
plots.summary: Brienne arrives in Maidenpool, seeking information about Sansa Stark. She navigates through interactions with Ser Hyle Hunt and Lord Randyll Tarly, while dealing with memories of past humiliations and unexpected kindnesses.

plots.name: Brienne of Tarth
plots.description: A female knight on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
plots.summary: Brienne negotiates with Nimble Dick Crabb for information about Sansa's possible whereabouts, agreeing to pay him to guide her to the Whispers in Crackclaw Point.

plots.name: Brienne of Tarth
plots.description: A female warrior on a quest to find Sansa Stark.
plots.summary: Brienne persists in her mission despite facing ridicule and obstacles. She refuses to give up her search for Sansa and continues to navigate challenges with determination.

plots.name: Brienne of Tarth
plots.description: A female warrior on a quest to find the Hound.
plots.summary: Brienne leads the group to the Quiet Isle, seeking information about the Hound. She observes the surroundings and interacts with the brothers, showing curiosity about their way of life and recent events.

conversations.name: Brienne of Tarth
conversations.thought: I must remain vigilant and protect our party, especially from Nimble Dick Crabb. Podrick's assistance could be vital, but I need to instruct him carefully without alarming him. I'm wary of our surroundings and our guide's intentions, yet I must maintain a calm exterior. My quest to find and protect Sansa Stark drives me forward, despite the dangers we face.

conversations.name: Brienne of Tarth
conversations.thought: I'm exhausted from my journey, but I can't give up. Sansa's safety depends on me fulfilling my oath to Lady Catelyn. This dwarf might have crucial information. I must be cautious in my questioning, not revealing too much about Sansa or my mission. I'm prepared to offer gold for any valuable leads. The mention of a fool intrigues me – could it be Ser Dontos? I need to know more about his companions and intentions.

conversations.name: Brienne of Tarth
conversations.thought: I must find Sansa at all costs, but I can't risk revealing too much about her identity. These fisherfolk might have seen something without realizing its importance. I need to be cautious yet thorough in my questioning. The weight of my oath to Lady Catelyn and the potential threat of Ser Shadrich weigh heavily on my mind. I must remain vigilant and ready for any danger.

conversations.name: Brienne of Tarth
conversations.thought: Determined yet weary, Brienne steels herself for another potentially fruitless lead. She's acutely aware of her conspicuous presence, recalling past mockeries at Highgarden. Despite setbacks, she remains committed to her oath to find Sansa Stark, hoping Nimble Dick might provide crucial information. She's prepared to endure discomfort and skepticism to fulfill her duty.

conversations.name: Brienne of Tarth
conversations.thought: I'm so close to a lead on Sansa, I can feel it. This man knows something, but I must tread carefully. Every coin spent, every word exchanged could bring me closer to fulfilling my oath to Lady Catelyn. I'm wary of deception, but desperate for information. I'll pay what I must, but I need to ensure the intelligence is genuine.

conversations.name: Brienne of Tarth
conversations.thought: I'm frustrated by Lord Tarly's dismissal but determined to continue my quest. I must find Lady Sansa to fulfill my oath to Lady Catelyn. The constant ridicule and obstacles weigh heavily on me, but I cannot falter. I'm concerned about finding safe shelter for Podrick and myself tonight, and I'm pondering our next move in the search for Sansa.

conversations.name: Brienne of Tarth
conversations.thought: Exhausted yet determined, Brienne surveys the room with keen interest. Her quest to find the Hound weighs heavily on her mind, but she's intrigued by the Isle's unique atmosphere. She's prepared to be diplomatic to gain information, while remaining alert for any signs of deception or danger. The Elder Brother's demeanor has caught her off-guard, and she's curious about what secrets this isolated community might hold.

utterances.message: [I need to be clear and firm, but not alarm Podrick too much.] Podrick, there will come a time when there are no more inns to shelter us. I do not trust our guide. When we make camp, can you watch over me as I sleep?

[I appreciate his eagerness, but I must temper it with caution.] No. (firmly) You are not to try and fight him. All I ask is that you watch him as I sleep, and wake me if he does anything suspicious. I wake quickly, you will find.
[I need to reassure him.] You're doing well, Podrick. Your vigilance is important to our safety.
[I should give him more specific instructions.] If you see Crabb approach our belongings or my sleeping area, wake me immediately. Don't confront him yourself.
[I hope I'm not overwhelming him.] And Podrick, remember to rest when I'm awake. We both need to stay alert on this journey.

[I must be careful not to reveal too much, but I need information.] I am looking for my sister. She's highborn, only three-and-ten, a pretty maid with blue eyes and auburn hair. You may have seen her traveling with a man. A knight, perhaps a fool. There's gold for the man who helps me find her.
[Could this be Ser Dontos? I must know more.] Did this fool have a red nose, full of broken veins?
[This could be a promising lead.] Where else did you see him?
[This fool seems to be trying to leave Westeros. Could Sansa be with him?] What was the fool doing at the Stinking Goose?
[Three? Who could the third person be?] Seeking passage for three? Not two?
[This is intriguing. I must follow this lead.] Did the fool find his ship?
[This could be important.] 'Fooled a fool.' What did he mean by that?
[I must appear friendly yet determined.] (approaches the fisherfolk) Good day to you. I wonder if I might ask you a question?
[I need to be specific but not reveal too much.] Have you seen a maid of three-and-ten along the road? A highborn maid with blue eyes and auburn hair?
[I should provide more details, but carefully.] She may have been traveling with a fool. It's important that I find her.
[They seem honest, but I must be sure.] Are you certain? Even the smallest detail could be helpful.
[They don't seem to know anything. I should move on.] I see. Thank you for your time. If you do happen to see or hear anything, I would be grateful if you could spread the word.
[I must remain focused on my quest, despite the unpleasant surroundings.] I am looking for a man called Nimble Dick.
[I must assure her of my peaceful intentions.] I want to talk with him. Why would I do him harm?
[I need her cooperation to find Dick.] If you would nod when he comes in I'd be thankful.
[I understand the way of things here.] (puts a copper star on the plank between them)
[This wine is terrible, but I must endure it while I wait.] (plucks a hair from her wine) [A hair as slender as my hopes of finding Sansa.]
[Where could Sansa be? The Vale seemed promising, but now...] [Lady Lysa is dead. Sansa could be anywhere now.]
[The memories of Highgarden still haunt me.] (blushes) [The mockery I expected, but the kindness... that was harder to bear.]
[I need to approach this carefully to get the information I need.] I heard you fooled a fool.
[I'll need to use coin to loosen his tongue.] (puts a silver stag on the barrel) King Robert.
[Could this be a lead to Sansa?] Was there a girl with him?
[Two girls? Could one be Arya?] (eyes widening) Two girls? Where were they headed?
[I need more details to go on.] Do you remember what he looked like?
[There must be more to this story.] Frightened why?
[This could be the lead I've been searching for.] What sort of help?
[I must know more, whatever the cost.] (puts another stag on the barrel) Tell me, and you'll have another.
[I understand his concern, but I can't abandon my quest.] They burned her home.

[His innocence is touching, but the reality is much harsher.] Gods cannot die, but girls can. Timeon was a cruel man and a murderer, but I do not think he lied about the Hound. We cannot go north until we know for certain. There will be other ships.
[We need to find a safe place for the night.] We'll try the ships in the harbor. Perhaps we can find a captain willing to let us sleep aboard.
[I must prepare him for disappointment.] Likely not, Pod. We may have to make do with hammocks or the deck itself. But it will be shelter from the elements.
[His resilience impresses me.] That's good, Pod. We may need that skill in the days to come. Come, let's try the east end of the harbor.
[The cups are beautifully made. Perhaps a compliment will encourage him to be more forthcoming.] These cups are lovely. Did you make them yourselves?
[We're getting off track. I need to steer the conversation back to the Hound.] Elder Brother, we've heard reports of the Hound attacking Saltpans. Do you know anything about this?

Brienne of Tarth.profile:
Brienne of Tarth is a towering, muscular woman who defies traditional gender roles in the world of Westeros. As a female knight, she stands out not only for her imposing physical presence but also for her unwavering dedication to honor and duty. Brienne's most defining characteristic is her steadfast commitment to the oath she swore to Catelyn Stark, driving her on a relentless quest to find and protect Sansa Stark.

Brienne's journey throughout "A Feast for Crows" is marked by her tireless search for Sansa, which takes her across treacherous terrains and into dangerous situations. Her cautious nature is evident in her interactions with potential informants and guides, such as Nimble Dick Crabb, as she carefully negotiates for information while remaining vigilant against deceit.

Despite facing constant ridicule and obstacles due to her unconventional appearance and role, Brienne maintains a stoic demeanor. Her past experiences, particularly at Highgarden where she faced both mockery and unexpected kindness, have shaped her character, making her resilient yet wary of others' intentions.

Brienne's skills as a warrior are formidable, as demonstrated by her defeat of the Bloody Mummers. However, her true strength lies in her moral compass and determination. She refuses to abandon her quest even when faced with dismissal from powerful figures like Lord Randyll Tarly, showcasing her unwavering resolve.

Throughout her journey, Brienne is accompanied by her squire, Podrick Payne, towards whom she shows a protective and mentoring attitude. Their relationship highlights Brienne's capacity for leadership and her softer side, despite her often stern exterior.

Brienne's character arc in the book is one of persistence in the face of adversity. She continues to pursue her mission to find Sansa Stark, navigating through political tensions, potential threats, and personal doubts. Her unwavering commitment to her oath, even when faced with seemingly insurmountable odds, defines her as a paragon of loyalty and honor in a world often lacking in both.

conversations.name: Yohn Royce
conversations.thought: This girl... there's something hauntingly familiar about her. Her features, her bearing - they remind me of someone, but I can't quite place it. Could Littlefinger be hiding more than just his ambitions? I must remain vigilant and observe closely. The future of the Vale depends on unraveling the mysteries surrounding Baelish and his supposed daughter. Every interaction could provide a clue.

utterances.message: [This girl reminds me of someone.] Do I know you, girl?

Yohn Royce.profile:
Lord Yohn Royce, also known as Bronze Yohn, is a powerful and influential nobleman in the Vale of Arryn. As the head of House Royce, he is known for his imposing presence and shrewd political acumen. Lord Royce is a key figure among the Lords Declarant, a group of Vale lords who oppose Petyr Baelish's rule as Lord Protector of the Vale following Lysa Arryn's death.

Yohn Royce is described as having a keen eye for detail and a strong sense of honor. His ability to recognize familiar features is demonstrated when he questions Alayne Stone's identity, sensing something familiar about her appearance. This showcases his perceptiveness and potential threat to those keeping secrets in the Vale.

In "A Feast for Crows," Lord Royce plays a significant role in the political maneuvering surrounding the Eyrie. His presence at the meeting with the other Lords Declarant highlights his importance in Vale politics. Royce's interaction with Alayne Stone (Sansa Stark in disguise) reveals his observant nature and his potential to uncover the truth behind Littlefinger's schemes.

Royce's character is marked by a combination of political savvy and traditional values. He is respected among his peers and appears to be a stabilizing force in the turbulent politics of the Vale. His suspicion of Petyr Baelish and his questioning of Alayne's identity demonstrate his commitment to uncovering the truth and protecting the interests of the Vale.

Throughout the story, Yohn Royce's actions and presence serve to increase tension and add depth to the complex political landscape of the Vale, making him a significant character in the unfolding drama of "A Feast for Crows."

plots.name: Brusco
plots.description: The man Cat lives and works with in Braavos.
plots.summary: Brusco owns the boat and business that Cat helps with, selling shellfish in the city.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, mother to King Tommen.
plots.summary: Cersei guides Tommen to the wake, worrying about his appearance and safety. She reflects on the differences between Tommen and Joffrey, and her own role as regent.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: Queen Regent, mother of King Tommen, daughter of Tywin Lannister.
plots.summary: Cersei maneuvers politically at her father's wake, making decisions about the Small Council and seeking to secure her power as regent.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: Jaime's twin sister and lover, Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms.
plots.summary: Cersei visits Jaime in secret, pleading with him to become Hand of the King. She fears her secrets being exposed and seeks Jaime's support and love.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: The Queen Regent, mother of King Tommen, paranoid and resentful of the Tyrells.
plots.summary: Cersei navigates the wedding with growing suspicion and anger, fearing for Tommen's safety and resenting the Tyrells' influence. She struggles to maintain control and contemplates future plans to secure her power.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: The Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, sister to Jaime and Tyrion Lannister.
plots.summary: Cersei is obsessed with finding and killing her brother Tyrion. She's paranoid and power-hungry, relying on Qyburn for information and support. She's haunted by a childhood prophecy and is preparing to assert her dominance in the small council.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: The Queen Regent, manipulative and power-hungry.
plots.summary: Cersei dominates the small council meeting, makes crucial decisions, and schemes against Margaery Tyrell by manipulating Ser Osney Kettleblack and Lady Merryweather.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, mother of King Tommen.
plots.summary: Cersei navigates political challenges and attempts to maintain control over her son and the realm. She is wary of Margaery Tyrell's influence and seeks to counter it.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: Queen Regent, Jaime's twin sister
plots.summary: Cersei is manipulative and power-hungry, ordering Jaime to Riverrun despite his protests. Their interaction reveals a strained relationship and hints at her infidelities.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: Queen Regent of the Seven Kingdoms, mother of King Tommen.
plots.summary: Cersei navigates political and religious tensions, manipulating the situation to her advantage by negotiating with the High Septon and reestablishing the Faith Militant.

plots.name: Cersei Lannister
plots.description: The Queen Regent, manipulative and paranoid
plots.summary: Cersei presides over the council meeting, making decisions that suit her political agenda while inwardly despising the Tyrells. She hopes to use the Ironborn threat and Loras' mission to Dragonstone to her advantage.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: I must mold Tommen into a strong ruler, unlike his current meekness. The realm needs a king like Joffrey, not this soft boy. I'll use this journey to instill proper behavior and appearance befitting a monarch. I'm concerned about Tommen's safety and the lack of public adoration. How can I maintain control and protect my son in this dangerous game of thrones?

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: I must secure Kevan's support as Hand of the King to maintain my grip on power. The Tyrells are overreaching, and I need a strong ally to counter their influence. Kevan's experience and loyalty to our family make him the ideal choice. I'm prepared to use any means necessary to convince him, including appealing to his sense of duty to Tywin's legacy and the realm's stability.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: Fear and desperation drive me here. I need Jaime's support more than ever. The realm is slipping from my grasp, and I must secure Jaime as Hand to maintain control. Our bond has always been my strength, but his recent distance worries me. I'm prepared to use any means necessary to convince him - seduction, manipulation, or appealing to his sense of duty.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: I'm surrounded by enemies masquerading as allies. The Tyrells are encroaching on my power, and I must protect Tommen at all costs. Margaery's charm is a facade, and her grandmother is a cunning serpent. I need to regain control and find a way to diminish their influence. Jaime doesn't understand the true extent of the danger we're in.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: My heart races with anticipation and dread. Could this truly be Tyrion's head? I must remain composed, regardless of the outcome. This could be the key to securing my power and fulfilling the prophecy that haunts me. I need to assess the situation carefully, balancing my eagerness for vengeance with the need for caution and control.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: I must exploit Osney's weaknesses to secure his loyalty and set my plan against Margaery in motion. The promise of power and pleasure should be enough to sway this simple-minded knight. I'll carefully guide him towards seducing Margaery and eliminating Jon Snow, ensuring my position remains unchallenged. This conversation requires utmost finesse to manipulate without revealing my true intentions.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: I must delicately balance Tommen's royal education while protecting him from Margaery's manipulations. He's too young to truly rule, but I can't alienate him. I need to redirect his attention and maintain my authority without seeming overbearing. Perhaps I can use this conversation to gauge Margaery's influence and find ways to counter it.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: I must maintain control over Jaime and ensure he follows my plans. His hesitation threatens my authority. I'll use our past intimacy and his insecurities to manipulate him if needed. I'm determined to secure my power, even if it means pushing Jaime away. His loyalty must be to me and my ambitions alone.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: I must assert my authority while appearing pious. These sparrows are a nuisance, but I can use this situation to my advantage. I need to secure Tommen's reign and rid the city of these bothersome peasants. The High Septon may be a problem, but perhaps I can manipulate him. I must be careful not to let my irritation show too much.

conversations.name: Cersei Lannister
conversations.thought: These Tyrells are a constant thorn in my side. I must use this Ironborn threat to my advantage, perhaps to weaken their position. I'll deflect their concerns and manipulate the situation to suit my needs. If I can get Loras out of the picture, it would be a significant win. I need to maintain control and appear authoritative while secretly relishing their discomfort.

utterances.message: [He's so naive. I must protect him.] Do you want to catch a chill? Your grandfather would want you to look a proper king at his wake. We will not appear at the Great Sept wet and bedraggled.

[He believes such nonsense. I must teach him to be stronger.] Jocelyn Swyft is a fool. If the gods could weep, they would have wept for your brother. Rain is rain. Close the curtain before you let any more in. That mantle is sable, would you have it soaked?
[He's too meek. A king must be strong.] Don't slump so. Sit like a king. Put your shoulders back and straighten your crown. Do you want it to tumble off your head in front of all your lords?
[He's so innocent. He doesn't understand how little people cared for Father.] This rain has driven them inside.
[Thinking to herself] King's Landing had never loved Lord Tywin. He never wanted love, though.
[I must convince him to accept. His support is crucial.] I know how much my father relied on you, Uncle. Now I must do the same.

[I need to explain why Jaime isn't suitable.] Jaime... I felt so lost with Father dead, I scarce knew what I was saying. Jaime is gallant, but a bit of a fool, let us be frank. Tommen needs a more seasoned man. Someone older...
[The thought of Mace Tyrell as Hand infuriates me.] (nostrils flaring) Never. (pushes a lock of hair off her brow) The Tyrells overreach themselves.

[I won't let the Tyrells gain more power.] Better that than suffer another Tyrell on the council. Rosby will make an adequate master of coin. You've seen that litter of his, with its carvings and silk draperies. His horses are better dressed than most knights. A man that rich should have no problem finding gold. As for Handship... who better to finish my father's work than the brother who shared all his counsels?
[I must not think of that whore in Father's bed.] He loved her very much. I know they are together now.
[He's wavering. I need to push harder.] No more than my father did.
[I can't believe he's resisting. Father would never have allowed this.] As does Tommen.

[I must convince him quickly. Time is running out.] The hour of the wolf. (She lowers her hood) Do you remember the first time I came to you like this? It was some dismal inn off Weasel Alley, and I put on servant's garb to get past Father's guards.
[I'm afraid, but I can't show it. I need him to see how serious this is.] (Speaking softly) Jaime, Kevan has refused me. He will not serve as Hand, he... he knows about us. He said as much.

[I need to make him understand the danger we're in.] Tyrion knew. Who can say what tales that vile dwarf may have told, or to whom? Uncle Kevan is the least of it. The High Septon... Tyrion raised him to the crown, when the fat one died. He may know as well.

[I must appeal to his sense of duty and love for me.] (Moving closer) You must be Tommen's Hand. I do not trust Mace Tyrell. What if he had a hand in Father's death? He may have been conspiring with Tyrion. The Imp could be on his way to Highgarden...
[I need to make this personal, to remind him of our bond.] Be my Hand, and we'll rule the Seven Kingdoms together, like a king and his queen.
[I can't let him refuse me. I'll use our children if I must.] I would, if I dared. But our son—
[His rejection hurts, but I can't give up.] (Flinching) You swore that you would always love me. It is not loving to make me beg.
[Desperation overwhelms me. I must make him understand how much I need him.] I need you. I need my other half. You are me, I am you. I need you with me. In me. Please, Jaime. Please.

[Fury and disappointment replace my desperation.] (Wiping tears away angrily) Very well. If it is battlefields you want, battlefields I shall give you. I was a fool to come. I was a fool ever to love you.
[I can't let anyone see how worried I am.] (whispers) I blame you for all this. Let them wed, you said. Margaery should be mourning Joffrey, not marrying his brother.
[I don't trust any Tyrell promise.] So she says.
[The Tyrells are still a threat.] And Ser Loras. Or have you forgotten your Sworn Brother?
[He can't be so naive.] Ser Loras is so Tyrell he pisses rosewater. He should never have been given a white cloak.
[He's changed, but not for the better.] It certainly changed you, and not for the better.
[I must remain composed, despite the stench and grotesque sight.] (examining the head closely) You've killed the wrong dwarf.
[I feel a mix of disappointment and irritation.] He has also grown a new nose. A rather bulbous one, I'd say. Tyrion's nose was hacked off in a battle.
[Anger rises within me, but I must control it.] You have wasted my time and slain an innocent man. I should have your own heads off.
[I realize I must not discourage future attempts.] Remove yourselves from my sight.
[Disgust and annoyance fill me.] Give it to Ser Meryn. No, in the sack, you lackwit. Yes. Ser Osmund, see them out.
[I must approach this delicately to ensure his cooperation.] Ser Osney, your loyal service has not gone unnoticed. I have a task that requires a man of your... particular talents.
[I'll appeal to his base desires first.] Tell me true, Ser Osney. Do you think our little queen is pretty?
[Perfect, he's taking the bait.] Why not both? (leaning in closer) Pluck the little rose for me, and you will not find me to be ungrateful.
[I must reassure him while maintaining the pressure.] Ages ago. Tommen is not Aegon the Unworthy. Have no fear, he will do as I bid him. I mean for Margaery to lose her head, not you.
[He's still hesitant. I need to sweeten the deal.] That too. Assuming she still has one. (tracing his scars) Unless you think Margaery would prove unresponsive to your... charms?
[Now to introduce the second part of my plan.] Tommen would have no choice but to send you to the Wall. But you will return. All you need to do is kill a boy.
[I have him now.] A bastard boy in league with Stannis. He's young and green, and you'll have a hundred men. Once this boy is dead, you'd get your pardon from the king.
[Time to seal the deal.] A queen must have a consort. One who knows no fear. Lord Kettleblack has a nice ring to it, don't you think?
[I must be firm but gentle with him. He's still so young.] Joffrey was twelve.
[I can smell Margaery's influence in this. I must nip this in the bud.] Who told you that?
